<MarginText>164/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Count is 0, then Insert does nothing. Otherwise, it computes the new length <i>NL</i> as the sum of the current length and Count; if the value of Last appropriate for length <i>NL</i> would be greater than Index{"_"}Type'Last, then Constraint{"_"}Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>165/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">If the current vector capacity is less than <i>NL</i>, Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Container, <i>NL</i>) is called to increase the vector capacity. Last{"_"}Index (Container) up by Count positions, and then inserts elements that are initialized by default (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>) in the positions starting at Before.<br /></p>

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">

<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Count is 0, Delete has no effect. Otherwise, Delete slides the elements (if any) starting at position Index + Count down to Index. Any exception raised during element assignment is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>190.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">

<MarginText>193/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                I, J      : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (I /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (J /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, I){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, J){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>194/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Swap exchanges the values of the elements designated by I and J.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>194.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>After a call to Swap, I designates the element value previously designated by J, and J designates the element value previously designated by I. The cursors do not become ambiguous from this operation. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>194.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>The implementation is not required to actually copy the elements if it can do the swap some other way. But it is allowed to copy the elements if needed. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>195/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First{"_"}Index (Container : Vector) return Index{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} First{"_"}Index'Result = Index{"_"}Type'First;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>196/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns the value Index{"_"}Type'First.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>196.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>We'd rather call this &ldquo;First&rdquo;, but then calling most routines in here with First (Some{"_"}Vect) would be ambiguous. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>197/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Vector) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is{"_"}Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, First'Result){"\n"}                 else First'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>198/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Container is empty, First returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the first element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>199/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First{"_"}Element (Container : Vector){"\n"}   return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>200/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Element (Container, First{"_"}Index (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>201/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last{"_"}Index (Container : Vector) return Extended{"_"}Index{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Length (Container) = 0 then Last{"_"}Index'Result = No{"_"}Index{"\n"}                 else Count{"_"}Type(Last{"_"}Index'Result - Index{"_"}Type'First) ={"\n"}                      Length (Container) - 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>202/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Container is empty, Last{"_"}Index returns No{"_"}Index. Otherwise, it returns the position of the last element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>203/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last (Container : Vector) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is{"_"}Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Last'Result){"\n"}                 else Last'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>204/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Container is empty, Last returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the last element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>205/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last{"_"}Element (Container : Vector){"\n"}   return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>206/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Element (Container, Last{"_"}Index (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>207/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then Next'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>208/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals No{"_"}Element or designates the last element of the container, then Next returns the value No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the element with index To{"_"}Index (Position) + 1 in the same vector as Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>208.1/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Container : Vector;{"\n"}               Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then Next'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 elsif Has{"_"}Element (Container, Next'Result) then{"\n"}                    To{"_"}Index (Container, Next'Result) ={"\n"}                    To{"_"}Index (Container, Position) + 1{"\n"}                 elsif Next'Result = No{"_"}Element then{"\n"}                    Position = Last (Container){"\n"}                 else False);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>208.2/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a cursor designating the next element in Container, if any.<br /></p>

<MarginText>209/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>210/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Next (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>210.1/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Container : in     Vector;{"\n"}                Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>210.2/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Next (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>211/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                 then Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>212/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals No{"_"}Element or designates the first element of the container, then Previous returns the value No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the element with index To{"_"}Index (Position) &ndash; 1 in the same vector as Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>212.1/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                   Position  : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 elsif Has{"_"}Element (Container, Previous'Result) then{"\n"}                   To{"_"}Index (Container, Previous'Result) ={"\n"}                   To{"_"}Index (Container, Position) - 1{"\n"}                 elsif Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element then{"\n"}                   Position = First (Container){"\n"}                 else False);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>212.2/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a cursor designating the previous element in Container, if any.<br /></p>

<MarginText>213/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>214/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Previous (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>214.1/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Container : in     Vector;{"\n"}                    Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>214.2/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Previous (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>215/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find{"_"}Index (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                     Item      : Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                     Index     : Index{"_"}Type := Index{"_"}Type'First){"\n"}   return Extended{"_"}Index;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>216/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at position Index and proceeds towards Last{"_"}Index (Container). If no equal element is found, then Find{"_"}Index returns No{"_"}Index. Otherwise, it returns the index of the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>217/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Vector;{"\n"}               Item      : Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}               Position  : Cursor := No{"_"}Element){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Find'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>218/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Find searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the first element if Position equals No{"_"}Element, and at the element designated by Position otherwise. It proceeds towards the last element of Container. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>219/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reverse{"_"}Find{"_"}Index (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                             Item      : Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                             Index     : Index{"_"}Type := Index{"_"}Type'Last){"\n"}   return Extended{"_"}Index;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>220/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at position Index or, if Index is greater than Last{"_"}Index (Container), at position Last{"_"}Index (Container). It proceeds towards First{"_"}Index (Container). If no equal element is found, then Reverse{"_"}Find{"_"}Index returns No{"_"}Index. Otherwise, it returns the index of the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>221/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reverse{"_"}Find (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                       Item      : Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                       Position  : Cursor := No{"_"}Element){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Reverse{"_"}Find'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Reverse{"_"}Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>222/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reverse{"_"}Find searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the last element if Position equals No{"_"}Element, and at the element designated by Position otherwise. It proceeds towards the first element of Container. If no equal element is found, then Reverse{"_"}Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>223/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Contains (Container : Vector;{"\n"}                   Item      : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>224/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Has{"_"}Element (Find (Container, Item)).<br /></p>

<p class="Indented4"><i>Paragraphs 225 and 226 were moved above.</i> <br /></p>

<MarginText>227/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Vector;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>228/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Invokes Process.<b>all</b> with a cursor that designates each element in Container, in index order. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>228.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>The purpose of the &ldquo;tamper with the cursors&rdquo; check is to prevent erroneous execution from the Position parameter of Process.<b>all</b> becoming invalid. This check takes place when the operations that tamper with the cursors of the container are called. The check cannot be made later (say in the body of Iterate), because that could cause the Position cursor to be invalid and potentially cause execution to become erroneous -- defeating the purpose of the check.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>228.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
There is no check needed if an attempt is made to insert or delete nothing (that is, Count = 0 or Length(Item) = 0).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>228.c/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The check is easy to implement: each container needs a counter. The counter is incremented when Iterate is called, and decremented when Iterate completes. If the counter is nonzero when an operation that inserts or deletes is called, Finalize is called, or one of the other operations in the list occurs, Program{"_"}Error is raised. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>229/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reverse{"_"}Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Vector;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>230/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterates over the elements in Container as per procedure Iterate, except that elements are traversed in reverse index order.<br /></p>

<MarginText>230.1/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0212-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Vector){"\n"}   return Vector{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>230.2/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each node in Container, starting with the first node and moving the cursor as per the Next function when used as a forward iterator, and starting with the last node and moving the cursor as per the Previous function when used as a reverse iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>230.3/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Vector; Start : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Vector{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} (Start /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                     (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Start){"\n"}                        or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>230.4/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns a reversible iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each node in Container, starting with the node designated by Start and moving the cursor as per the Next function when used as a forward iterator, or moving the cursor as per the Previous function when used as a reverse iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>230.a/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Exits are allowed from the loops created using the iterator objects. In particular, to stop the iteration at a particular cursor, just add <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>230.b/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
exit when Cur = Stop;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>230.c/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
in the body of the loop (assuming that Cur is the loop parameter and Stop is the cursor that you want to stop at). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>231/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "{"<"}" of Generic{"_"}Sorting is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of element values. It should define a strict weak ordering relationship (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>); it should not modify Container. If the actual for "{"<"}" behaves in some other manner, the behavior of the subprograms of Generic{"_"}Sorting are unspecified. The number of times the subprograms of Generic{"_"}Sorting call "{"<"}" is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>232/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Sorted (Container : Vector) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>233/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if the elements are sorted smallest first as determined by the generic formal "{"<"}" operator; otherwise, Is{"_"}Sorted returns False. Any exception raised during evaluation of "{"<"}" is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>234/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Sort (Container : in out Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>235/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reorders the elements of Container such that the elements are sorted smallest first as determined by the generic formal "{"<"}" operator provided. Any exception raised during evaluation of "{"<"}" is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>235.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>This implies swapping the elements, usually including an intermediate copy. This means that the elements will usually be copied. (As with Swap, if the implementation can do this some other way, it is allowed to.) Since the elements are nonlimited, this usually will not be a problem. Note that there is  below that the implementation should use a sort that minimizes copying of elements.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>235.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The sort is not required to be stable (and the fast algorithm required will not be stable). If a stable sort is needed, the user can include the original location of the element as an extra "sort key". We considered requiring the implementation to do that, but it is mostly extra overhead -- usually there is something already in the element that provides the needed stability. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>236/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Merge (Target  : in out Vector;{"\n"}                 Source  : in out Vector){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Target) {"<"}= Maximum{"_"}Length - Length (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                ((Length (Source) = 0 or else{"\n"}                   not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source)){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                    Result{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                       Length (Source)'Old + Length (Target)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                    (Length (Source) = 0 and then{"\n"}                     Length (Target) = Result{"_"}Length and then{"\n"}                     Capacity (Target) {">"}= Result{"_"}Length));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>237/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0021-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Merge removes elements from Source and inserts them into Target; afterwards, Target contains the union of the elements that were initially in Source and Target; Source is left empty. If Target and Source are initially sorted smallest first, then Target is ordered smallest first as determined by the generic formal "{"<"}" operator; otherwise, the order of elements in Target is unspecified. Any exception raised during evaluation of "{"<"}" is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>237.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>It is a bounded error if either of the vectors is unsorted, see below. The bounded error can be recovered by sorting Target after the merge call, or the vectors can be pretested with Is{"_"}Sorted. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>237.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The Merge operation will usually require copying almost all of the elements. One implementation strategy would be to extend Target to the appropriate length, then copying elements from the back of the vectors working towards the front. An alternative approach would be to allocate a new internal data array of the appropriate length, copy the elements into it in an appropriate order, and then replacing the data array in Target with the temporary. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>237.1/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The nested package Vectors.Stable provides a type Stable.Vector that represents a <i>stable</i> vector, which is one that cannot grow and shrink. Such a vector can be created by calling the To{"_"}Vector or Copy functions, or by establishing a <i>stabilized view</i> of an ordinary vector.<br /></p>

<MarginText>237.2/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The subprograms of package Containers.Vectors that have a parameter or result of type Vector are included in the nested package Stable with the same specification, except that the following are omitted:<br /></p>

<MarginText>237.3/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<p class="Indented2">Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited, Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited, Reserve{"_"}Capacity, Assign, Move, Insert, Insert{"_"}Space, Insert{"_"}Vector, Append, Append{"_"}Vector, Prepend, Prepend{"_"}Vector, Clear, Delete, Delete{"_"}First, Delete{"_"}Last, and Set{"_"}Length <br /></p>

<MarginText>237.4/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<p>The generic package Generic{"_"}Sorting is also included with the same specification, except that Merge is omitted.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>237.b.1/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The names Vector and Cursor mean the types declared in the nested package in these subprogram specifications. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>237.b.2/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>The omitted routines are those that tamper with cursors or elements (or test that state). The model is that it is impossible to tamper with cursors or elements of a stable view since no such operations are included. Thus tampering checks are not needed for a stable view, and we omit the operations associated with those checks. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>237.5/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The operations of this package are equivalent to those for ordinary vectors, except that the calls to Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited and Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited that occur in preconditions are replaced by False, and any that occur in postconditions are replaced by True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>237.6/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0439-1"]} />
<p>If a stable vector is declared with the Base discriminant designating a pre-existing ordinary vector, the stable vector represents a stabilized view of the underlying ordinary vector, and any operation on the stable vector is reflected on the underlying ordinary vector. While a stabilized view exists, any operation that tampers with elements performed on the underlying vector is prohibited. The finalization of a stable vector that provides such a view removes this restriction on the underlying ordinary vector [(though some other restriction can exist due to other concurrent iterations or stabilized views)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>237.7/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0438-1"]} />
<p>If a stable vector is declared without specifying Base, the object is necessarily initialized. The initializing expression of the stable vector, [typically a call on To{"_"}Vector or Copy], determines the Length of the vector. The Length of a stable vector never changes after initialization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>237.c/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0438-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Initialization is required as the type is indefinite, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>238/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Reading the value of an empty element by calling Element, Query{"_"}Element, Update{"_"}Element, Constant{"_"}Reference, Reference, Swap, Is{"_"}Sorted, Sort, Merge, "=", Find, or Reverse{"_"}Find is a bounded error. The implementation may treat the element as having any normal value (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-13/AA-13.9#Subclause_13.9.1">13.9.1</a>) of the element type, or raise Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error before modifying the vector.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>238.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>For instance, a default initialized element could be returned. Or some previous value of an element. But returning random junk is not allowed if the type has default initial value(s).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>238.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Assignment and streaming of empty elements are <b>not</b> bounded errors. This is consistent with regular composite types, for which assignment and streaming of uninitialized components do not cause a bounded error, but reading the uninitialized component does cause a bounded error.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>238.c/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
There are other operations which are defined in terms of the operations listed above. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>239/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Calling Merge in an instance of Generic{"_"}Sorting with either Source or Target not ordered smallest first using the provided generic formal "{"<"}" operator is a bounded error. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised after Target is updated as described for Merge, or the operation works as defined.<br /></p>

<MarginText>239.1/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error for the actual function associated with a generic formal subprogram, when called as part of an operation of this package, to tamper with elements of any Vector parameter of the operation. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised, or the operation works as defined on the value of the Vector either prior to, or subsequent to, some or all of the modifications to the Vector.<br /></p>

<MarginText>239.2/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram declared in the visible part of Containers.Vectors when the associated container has been finalized. If the operation takes Container as an <b>in out</b> parameter, then it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. Otherwise, the operation either proceeds as it would for an empty container, or it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error.<br /></p>

<MarginText>240/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A Cursor value is <i>ambiguous</i> if any of the following have occurred since it was created:<br /></p>

<MarginText>241/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0400-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>Insert, Insert{"_"}Space, Insert{"_"}Vector, or Delete has been called on the vector that contains the element the cursor designates with an index value (or a cursor designating an element at such an index value) less than or equal to the index value of the element designated by the cursor; or<br /></li>
<MarginText>242/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<li>The vector that contains the element it designates has been passed to the Sort or Merge procedures of an instance of Generic{"_"}Sorting, or to the Reverse{"_"}Elements procedure.<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>243/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram other than "=" or Has{"_"}Element declared in Containers.Vectors with an ambiguous (but not invalid, see below) cursor parameter. Possible results are:<br /></p>

<MarginText>244/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The cursor may be treated as if it were No{"_"}Element;<br /></li>
<MarginText>245/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<li>The cursor may designate some element in the vector (but not necessarily the element that it originally designated);<br /></li>
<MarginText>246/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<li>Constraint{"_"}Error may be raised; or<br /></li>
<MarginText>247/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<li>Program{"_"}Error may be raised.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>247.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Cursors are made ambiguous if an Insert or Delete occurs that moves the elements in the internal array including the designated ones. After such an operation, the cursor probably still designates an element (although it might not after a deletion), but it is a <i>different</i> element. That violates the definition of cursor &mdash; it designates a particular element.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>247.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
For "=" or Has{"_"}Element, the cursor works normally (it would not be No{"_"}Element). We don't want to trigger an exception simply for comparing a bad cursor.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>247.c/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
While it is possible to check for these cases or ensure that cursors survive such operations, in many cases the overhead necessary to make the check (or ensure cursors continue to designate the same element) is substantial in time or space. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>248/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A Cursor value is <i>invalid</i> if any of the following have occurred since it was created: <br /></p>

<MarginText>249/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The vector that contains the element it designates has been finalized;<br /></li>
<MarginText>249.1/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<li>The vector that contains the element it designates has been used as the Target of a call to Assign, or as the target of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>;<br /></li>
<MarginText>250/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<li>[The vector that contains the element it designates has been used as the Source or Target of a call to Move;] or <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>250.a/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Move has been reworded in terms of Assign and Clear, which are covered by other bullets, so this text is redundant. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>251/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The element it designates has been deleted or removed from the vector that previously contained the element. <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>251.a/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>An element can be removed via calls to Set{"_"}Length, Clear, and Merge; and indirectly via calls to Assign and Move. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>252/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The result of "=" or Has{"_"}Element is unspecified if it is called with an invalid cursor parameter. Execution is erroneous if any other subprogram declared in Containers.Vectors is called with an invalid cursor parameter.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>252.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>The list above (combined with the bounded error cases) is intended to be exhaustive. In other cases, a cursor value continues to designate its original element. For instance, cursor values survive the appending of new elements. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>252.1/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Execution is erroneous if the vector associated with the result of a call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized before the result object returned by the call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>252.b/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Each object of Reference{"_"}Type and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type probably contains some reference to the originating container. If that container is prematurely finalized (which is only possible via Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation, as accessibility checks prevent passing a container to Reference that will not live as long as the result), the finalization of the object of Reference{"_"}Type will try to access a nonexistent object. This is a normal case of a dangling pointer created by Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation; we have to explicitly mention it here as the pointer in question is not visible in the specification of the type. (This is the same reason we have to say this for invalid cursors.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>253/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>No storage associated with a vector object shall be lost upon assignment or scope exit.<br /></p>

<MarginText>254/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The execution of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> for a vector shall have the effect of copying the elements from the source vector object to the target vector object and changing the length of the target object to that of the source object.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>254.a/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0298-1", "AI12-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>An assignment of a Vector is a &ldquo;deep&rdquo; copy; that is the elements are copied as well as the data structures. We say &ldquo;effect of&rdquo; in order to allow the implementation to avoid copying elements immediately if it wishes. For instance, an implementation that avoided copying until one of the containers is modified would be allowed. (Note that such an implementation would require care, as Query{"_"}Element and Constant{"_"}Reference both could be used to access an element which later needs to be reallocated while the parameter or reference still exists, potentially leaving the parameter or reference pointing at the wrong element.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>255/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Containers.Vectors should be implemented similarly to an array. In particular, if the length of a vector is <i>N</i>, then<br /></p>

<MarginText>256/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>the worst-case time complexity of Element should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>); <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>256.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of Element for Containers.Vector should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>257/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>the worst-case time complexity of Append with Count=1 when <i>N</i> is less than the capacity of the vector should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>); and <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>257.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of Append with Count = 1 when <i>N</i> is less than the capacity for Containers.Vector should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>258/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>the worst-case time complexity of Prepend with Count=1 and Delete{"_"}First with Count=1 should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i> log <i>N</i>). <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>258.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of Prepend with Count = 1 and Delete{"_"}First with Count=1 for Containers.Vectors should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i> log <i>N</i>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>258.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We do not mean to overly constrain implementation strategies here. However, it is important for portability that the performance of large containers has roughly the same factors on different implementations. If a program is moved to an implementation that takes <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>) time to access elements, that program could be unusable when the vectors are large. We allow <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>) access because the proportionality constant and caching effects are likely to be larger than the log factor, and we don't want to discourage innovative implementations. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>259/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The worst-case time complexity of a call on procedure Sort of an instance of Containers.Vectors.Generic{"_"}Sorting should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2), and the average time complexity should be better than <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>259.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of a call on procedure Sort of an instance of Containers.Vectors.Generic{"_"}Sorting should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2), and the average time complexity should be better than <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>259.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>In other words, we're requiring the use of a better than <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2) sorting algorithm, such as Quicksort. No bubble sorts allowed! <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>260/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Containers.Vectors.Generic{"_"}Sorting.Sort and Containers.Vectors.Generic{"_"}Sorting.Merge should minimize copying of elements. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>260.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Containers.Vectors.Generic{"_"}Sorting.Sort and Containers.Vectors.Generic{"_"}Sorting.Merge should minimize copying of elements.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>260.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>We do not mean &ldquo;absolutely minimize&rdquo; here; we're not intending to require a single copy for each element. Rather, we want to suggest that the sorting algorithm chosen is one that does not copy items unnecessarily. Bubble sort would not meet this advice, for instance. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>261/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>261.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Containers.Vectors.Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>261.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Usually that can be accomplished simply by moving the pointer(s) to the internal data structures from the Source vector to the Target vector. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>262/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If an exception is propagated from a vector operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a vector unless specified by the operation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>262.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>If an exception is propagated from a vector operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a vector unless specified by the operation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>262.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is important so that programs can recover from errors. But we don't want to require heroic efforts, so we just require documentation of cases where this can't be accomplished. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>263/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0440-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
NOTE 1   All elements of a vector occupy locations in the internal array. If a sparse container is required, a Hashed{"_"}Map can be used rather than a vector.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
NOTE 2   If Index{"_"}Type'Base'First = Index{"_"}Type'First an instance of Ada.Containers.Vectors will raise Constraint{"_"}Error. A value below Index{"_"}Type'First is required so that an empty vector has a meaningful value of Last{"_"}Index.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.a/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This property is the main reason why only integer types (as opposed to any discrete type) are allowed as the index type of a vector. An enumeration or modular type would require a subtype in order to meet this requirement. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.b/2_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The package Containers.Vectors is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.c/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Subprograms Assign and Copy are added to Containers.Vectors. If an instance of Containers.Vectors is referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, and an entity <i>E</i> with the same <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.1#S0022">defining_identifier</a></code> as a new entity in Containers.Vectors is defined in a package that is also referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, the entity <i>E</i> may no longer be use-visible, resulting in errors. This should be rare and is easily fixed if it does occur. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.d/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added iterator, reference, and indexing support to make vector containers more convenient to use. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.e/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Generalized the definition of Reserve{"_"}Capacity and Move. Specified which elements are read/written by stream attributes.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.f/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover tampering by generic actual subprograms.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.g/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover access to finalized vector containers.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.h/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Redefined "{"<"}" actuals to require a strict weak ordering; the old definition allowed indeterminant comparisons that would not have worked in a container.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.i/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a pragma Remote{"_"}Types so that containers can be used in distributed programs.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.j/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Revised the definition of invalid cursors to cover missing (and new) cases.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.k/3_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Defined when a container prohibits tampering in order to more clearly define where the check is made and the exception raised. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.l/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Tampering with elements is now defined to be equivalent to tampering with cursors for ordinary containers. If a program requires tampering detection to work, it might fail in Ada 2022. Specifically, if a program requires Program{"_"}Error to be raised by a routine that (only) tampers with elements in Ada 2012 (such as Replace{"_"}Element) when called in a context that does not allow tampering with elements (such as Update{"_"}Element), the routine will work as defined instead of raising Program{"_"}Error in Ada 2022. Needless to say, this shouldn't happen outside of test programs. Note that such contexts still prohibit tampering with cursors, so routines like Insert and Delete will still raise Program{"_"}Error in this case.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.m/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Trying to insert or concatenate more than Count{"_"}Type'Last elements will now raise Constraint{"_"}Error rather than Capacity{"_"}Error. This is extremely unlikely to happen, as Count{"_"}Type'Last is typically at least 2{"*"}{"*"}31-1, so most such vectors will exceed memory before reaching this error. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.n/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0339-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A number of new subprograms, types, and even a nested package were added to Containers.Vectors to better support contracts and stable views. Therefore, a use clause conflict is possible; see the introduction of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/">Annex A</a> for more on this topic.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.o/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0005-1", "AI12-0212-1", "AI12-0400-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Vector objects now support aggregates. This introduces a potential incompatibility for overloaded routines, including the "&" operations defined in this package. If the Element{"_"}Type of the vector is a type that allows aggregates (such as a record type), then calls to the "&" operations with an aggregate element will become ambiguous in Ada 2022, while they would have been legal in Ada 2012. This can be fixed by qualifying the aggregate with the element type.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.p/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0400-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> The Insert, Append, and Prepend operations that operate on two vectors have been renamed Insert{"_"}Vector, Append{"_"}Vector, and Prepend{"_"}Vector, respectively. This was done in order to eliminate the aggregate ambiguity for the commonly used single element Append and Insert routines. The renamed routines are rarely used in Ada 2012 code, so the impact should be minimal. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.q/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0196-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> To{"_"}Cursor and Replace{"_"}Element are now defined such that they can be used concurrently so long as they operate on different elements. This allows some container operations to be used in parallel without separate synchronization.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.r/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Vectors now support indexed container aggregates, so <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-4/AA-4.3#S0106">aggregate</a></code> syntax can be used to create Vectors.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.s/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0266-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The iterator for the entire container now can return a parallel iterator which can be used to process the container in parallel. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.t/4_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0110-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Clarified that tampering checks precede all other checks made by a subprogram (but come after those associated with the call).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.u/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>264.v/5_A.18.2</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0400-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Split the Append routine into two routines rather than having a single routine with a default parameter, in order that a routine with the appropriate profile for the Aggregate aspect exists. This change should not change the behavior of any existing code. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.3"></a>

## A.18.3  The Generic Package Containers.Doubly_Linked_Lists

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists provides private types List and Cursor, and a set of operations for each type. A list container is optimized for insertion and deletion at any position. <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A doubly-linked list container object manages a linked list of internal <i>nodes</i>, each of which contains an element and pointers to the next (successor) and previous (predecessor) internal nodes. A cursor designates a particular node within a list (and by extension the element contained in that node). A cursor keeps designating the same node (and element) as long as the node is part of the container, even if the node is moved in the container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The <i>length</i> of a list is the number of elements it contains. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists has the following declaration: <br /></p>
