   ... -- not specified by the language{"\n"}
<MarginText>54/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
end Ada.Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>55/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "=" on Element{"_"}Type values is expected to define a reflexive and symmetric relationship and return the same result value each time it is called with a particular pair of values. If it behaves in some other manner, the functions Find, Reverse{"_"}Find, and "=" on list values return an unspecified value. The exact arguments and number of calls of this generic formal function by the functions Find, Reverse{"_"}Find, and "=" on list values are unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>If the actual function for "=" is not symmetric and consistent, the result returned by the listed functions cannot be predicted. The implementation is not required to protect against "=" raising an exception, or returning random results, or any other &ldquo;bad&rdquo; behavior. And it can call "=" in whatever manner makes sense. But note that only the results of Find, Reverse{"_"}Find, and List "=" are unspecified; other subprograms are not allowed to break if "=" is bad (they aren't expected to use "="). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>56/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The type List is used to represent lists. The type List needs finalization (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-7/AA-7.6">7.6</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>57/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Empty{"_"}List represents the empty List object. It has a length of 0. If an object of type List is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as Empty{"_"}List.<br /></p>

<MarginText>58/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>No{"_"}Element represents a cursor that designates no element. If an object of type Cursor is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>59/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0434-1"]} />
<p>The primitive "=" operator for type Cursor returns True if both cursors are No{"_"}Element, or designate the same element in the same container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>59.a/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0434-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>&ldquo;The primitive "=" operator&rdquo; is the one with two parameters of type Cursor which returns Boolean. We're not talking about some other (hidden) primitive function named "=". <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>60/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Execution of the default implementation of the Input, Output, Read, or Write attribute of type Cursor raises Program{"_"}Error.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>60.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>A cursor will probably be implemented in terms of one or more access values, and the effects of streaming access values is unspecified. Rather than letting the user stream junk by accident, we mandate that streaming of cursors raise Program{"_"}Error by default. The attributes can always be specified if there is a need to support streaming. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>60.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>List'Write for a List object <i>L</i> writes Length(<i>L</i>) elements of the list to the stream. It may also write additional information about the list.<br /></p>

<MarginText>60.2/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>List'Read reads the representation of a list from the stream, and assigns to <i>Item</i> a list with the same length and elements as was written by List'Write.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>60.b/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Streaming more elements than the container length is wrong. For implementation implications of this rule, see the Implementation Note in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>61/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>[Some operations check for &ldquo;tampering with cursors&rdquo; of a container because they depend on the set of elements of the container remaining constant, and others check for &ldquo;tampering with elements&rdquo; of a container because they depend on elements of the container not being replaced.] When tampering with cursors is <i>prohibited</i> for a particular list object <i>L</i>, Program{"_"}Error is propagated by the finalization of <i>L</i>[, as well as by a call that passes <i>L</i> to certain of the operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation]. Similarly, when tampering with elements is <i>prohibited</i> for <i>L</i>, Program{"_"}Error is propagated by a call that passes <i>L</i> to certain of the other operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation.<br /></p>

<p><i>Paragraphs 62 through 69 are removed as preconditions now describe these rules.</i> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>65.a.1/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>We don't need to explicitly mention <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>, because that finalizes the target object as part of the operation, and finalization of an object is already defined as tampering with cursors. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>69.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has{"_"}Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>69.3/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Position designates an element, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>69.c/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>This function might not detect cursors that designate deleted elements; such cursors are invalid (see below) and the result of calling Has{"_"}Element with an invalid cursor is unspecified (but not erroneous). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>69.4/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has{"_"}Element (Container : List; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>69.5/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Position designates an element in Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>69.d/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>If Position is No{"_"}Element, Has{"_"}Element returns False. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>70/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : List) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>71/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Left and Right denote the same list object, then the function returns True. If Left and Right have different lengths, then the function returns False. Otherwise, it compares each element in Left to the corresponding element in Right using the generic formal equality operator. If any such comparison returns False, the function returns False; otherwise, it returns True. Any exception raised during evaluation of element equality is propagated. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>71.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality function is unspecified for all of the operations that use it in this package, so an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Specifically, there is no requirement to call the formal equality additional times once the answer has been determined. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>71.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : List) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>71.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with cursors or tampering with elements is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>71.b/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Prohibiting tampering with elements also needs to prohibit tampering with cursors, as deleting an element is similar to replacing it. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>71.c/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Various contracts elsewhere in this specification require that this function be implemented with synchronized data. Moreover, it is possible for tampering to be prohibited by multiple operations (sequentially or in parallel). Therefore, tampering needs to be implemented with an atomic or protected counter. The counter is initialized to zero, and is incremented when tampering is prohibited, and decremented when leaving an area that prohibited tampering. Function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited returns True if the counter is nonzero. (Note that any case where the result is not well-defined for one task is incorrect use of shared variables and would be erroneous by the rules of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-9/AA-9.10">9.10</a>, so no special protection is needed to read the counter.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>71.3/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : List) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>71.4/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Always returns False[, regardless of whether tampering with elements is prohibited].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>71.d/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>A definite element cannot change size, so we allow operations that tamper with elements even when tampering with elements is prohibited. That's not true for the indefinite containers, which is why this kind of tampering exists. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>72/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Length (Container : List) return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>73/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns the number of elements in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>74/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Empty (Container : List) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is{"_"}Empty'Result = (Length (Container) = 0);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Container is empty.<br /></p>

<MarginText>76/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out List){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>77/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Removes all the elements from Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>78/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Position : Cursor) return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>79/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Element returns the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>79.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : List;{"\n"}                  Position  : Cursor) return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                   raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>79.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Element returns the element designated by Position in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>80/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace{"_"}Element (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                           Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           New{"_"}item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>81/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Replace{"_"}Element assigns the value New{"_"}Item to the element designated by Position. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace{"_"}Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query{"_"}Element{"\n"}  (Position : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process  : not null access procedure (Element : in Element{"_"}Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>83/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0021-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Query{"_"}Element calls Process.<b>all</b> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of the list that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>83.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query{"_"}Element{"\n"}  (Container : in List;{"\n"}   Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Element : in Element{"_"}Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>83.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Query{"_"}Element calls Process.<b>all</b> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>84/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update{"_"}Element{"\n"}  (Container : in out List;{"\n"}   Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure{"\n"}                   (Element : in out Element{"_"}Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>85/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Update{"_"}Element calls Process.<b>all</b> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">If Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<b>all</b> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>86.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>This means that the elements cannot be directly allocated from the heap; it must be possible to change the discriminants of the element in place. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>86.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}      (Element : not null access constant Element{"_"}Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit{"_"}Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} (raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}
<MarginText>86.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
type Reference{"_"}Type (Element : not null access Element{"_"}Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit{"_"}Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} (raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>86.3/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">The types Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type and Reference{"_"}Type need finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86.4/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>86.b/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>It is expected that Reference{"_"}Type (and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type) will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>86.5/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant{"_"}Reference (Container : aliased in List;{"\n"}                             Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                    raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) or else{"\n"}                    raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>86.6/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Constant{"_"}Indexing and Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a list given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86.7/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Constant{"_"}Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant{"_"}Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86.8/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference (Container : aliased in out List;{"\n"}                    Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                    raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) or else {"\n"}                    raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>86.9/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Variable{"_"}Indexing and Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a list given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86.10/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86.11/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out List; Source : in List){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>86.12/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the elements of Source are copied to Target as for an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> assigning Source to Target. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>86.c/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This routine exists for compatibility with the bounded list container. For an unbounded list, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave identically. For a bounded list, := will raise an exception if the container capacities are different, while Assign will not raise an exception if there is enough room in the target. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>86.13/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : List){"\n"}   return List{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} {"\n"}           Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>86.14/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a list whose elements match the elements of Source.<br /></p>

<MarginText>87/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out List;{"\n"}                Source : in out List){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                    Length (Target) = Length (Source'Old) and then{"\n"}                    Length (Source) = 0);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>88/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the operation is equivalent to Assign (Target, Source) followed by Clear (Source).<br /></p>

<MarginText>89/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>90/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert inserts Count copies of New{"_"}Item prior to the element designated by Before. If Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new elements are inserted after the last node (if any). Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>90.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The check on Before checks that the cursor does not belong to some other Container. This check implies that a reference to the container is included in the cursor value. This wording is not meant to require detection of dangling cursors; such cursors are defined to be invalid, which means that execution is erroneous, and any result is allowed (including not raising an exception). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>91/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container){"\n"}                and then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>92/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0257-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert allocates Count copies of New{"_"}Item, and inserts them prior to the element designated by Before. If Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new elements are inserted after the last element (if any). Position designates the first newly-inserted element, or if Count equals 0, then Position is assigned the value of Before. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>93/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container){"\n"}                and then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>94/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0257-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert inserts Count new elements prior to the element designated by Before. If Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new elements are inserted after the last node (if any). The new elements are initialized by default (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>). Position designates the first newly-inserted element, or if Count equals 0, then Position is assigned the value of Before. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>95/5_A.18.3</MarginText>

<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />

<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Append (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - Count{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + Count = Length (Container);{"\n"}

<MarginText>98.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Append (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old + 1 = Length (Container);{"\n"}

<MarginText>99/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                  Position  : in out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old - Count {"<"}= Length (Container){"\n"}                and then Position = No{"_"}Element;{"\n"}

<MarginText>100/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Delete removes (from Container) Count elements starting at the element designated by Position (or all of the elements starting at Position if there are fewer than Count elements starting at Position). Finally, Position is set to No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>101/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete{"_"}First (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old - Count {"<"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>102/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0021-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Length (Container) {"<"}= Count, then Delete{"_"}First is equivalent to Clear (Container). Otherwise, it removes the first Count nodes from Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>103/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete{"_"}Last (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                       Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container)'Old - Count {"<"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>104/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />

<MarginText>105/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reverse{"_"}Elements (Container : in out List){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>106/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reorders the elements of Container in reverse order.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>106.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Unlike the similar routine for a vector, elements should not be copied; rather, the nodes should be exchanged. Cursors are expected to reference the same elements afterwards. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>107/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                I, J      : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (I /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (J /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, I){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, J){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>108/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Swap exchanges the values of the elements designated by I and J.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>108.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>After a call to Swap, I designates the element value previously designated by J, and J designates the element value previously designated by I. The cursors do not become ambiguous from this operation. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>108.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>The implementation is not required to actually copy the elements if it can do the swap some other way. But it is allowed to copy the elements if needed. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>109/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap{"_"}Links (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                      I, J      : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (I /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (J /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, I){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, J){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>110/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Swap{"_"}Links exchanges the nodes designated by I and J.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>110.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Unlike Swap, this exchanges the nodes, not the elements. No copying is performed. I and J designate the same elements after this call as they did before it. This operation can provide better performance than Swap if the element size is large. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>111/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Splice (Target   : in out List;{"\n"}                  Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  Source   : in out List){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Target, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) or else{"\n"}                 Length (Target) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - Length (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                   (declare{"\n"}                      Result{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                         Length (Source)'Old + Length (Target)'Old;{"\n"}                    begin{"\n"}                      Length (Source) = 0 and then{"\n"}                      Length (Target) = Result{"_"}Length));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>112/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Source denotes the same object as Target, the operation has no effect. Otherwise, Splice reorders elements such that they are removed from Source and moved to Target, immediately prior to Before. If Before equals No{"_"}Element, the nodes of Source are spliced after the last node of Target.<br /></p>

<MarginText>113/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Splice (Target   : in out List;{"\n"}                  Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  Source   : in out List;{"\n"}                  Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Source, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Target, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) or else{"\n"}                 Length (Target) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Org{"_"}Target{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Target)'Old;{"\n"}                   Org{"_"}Source{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Source)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                    (if Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                        Position = Position'Old{"\n"}                     else Length (Source) = Org{"_"}Source{"_"}Length - 1 and then{"\n"}                        Length (Target) = Org{"_"}Target{"_"}Length + 1 and then{"\n"}                        Has{"_"}Element (Target, Position)));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>114/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Source denotes the same object as Target, then there is no effect if Position equals Before, else the element designated by Position is moved immediately prior to Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, after the last element. Otherwise, the element designated by Position is removed from Source and moved to Target, immediately prior to Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, after the last element of Target. Position is updated to represent an element in Target. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>114.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>If Source is the same as Target, and Position = Before, or Next(Position) = Before, Splice has no effect, as the element does not have to move to meet the postcondition. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>115/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Splice (Container: in out List;{"\n"}                  Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  Position : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"}  Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>116/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals Before there is no effect. Otherwise, the element designated by Position is moved immediately prior to Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, after the last element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>117/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Container is empty, First returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the first node in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>121/5_A.18.3</MarginText>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last (Container : List) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is{"_"}Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Last'Result){"\n"}                 else Last'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

<MarginText>122/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />

<MarginText>123/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />

<MarginText>124/2_A.18.3</MarginText>

<MarginText>125/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then Next'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

<MarginText>126/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals No{"_"}Element or designates the last element of the container, then Next returns the value No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the successor of the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>126.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginText>126.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />

<MarginText>127/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then {"\n"}                   Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

<MarginText>128/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals No{"_"}Element or designates the first element of the container, then Previous returns the value No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor that designates the predecessor of the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>128.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Container : List;{"\n"}                   Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then {"\n"}                   Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 elsif Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element then{"\n"}                   Position = First (Container){"\n"}                 else Has{"_"}Element (Container, Previous'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>128.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a cursor designating the predecessor of the element designated by Position in Container, if any.<br /></p>

<MarginText>129/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>130/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Next (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>130.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Container : in     List;{"\n"}                Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>130.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Next (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>131/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>132/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Previous (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>132.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Container : in     List;{"\n"}                    Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>132.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Previous (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>133/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : List;{"\n"}               Item      : Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}               Position  : Cursor := No{"_"}Element){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Find'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>134/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Find searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the element designated by Position, or at the first element if Position equals No{"_"}Element. It proceeds towards Last (Container). If no equal element is found, then Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>135/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reverse{"_"}Find (Container : List;{"\n"}                       Item      : Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                       Position  : Cursor := No{"_"}Element){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Reverse{"_"}Find'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Reverse{"_"}Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>136/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Find searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the element designated by Position, or at the last element if Position equals No{"_"}Element. It proceeds towards First (Container). If no equal element is found, then Reverse{"_"}Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>137/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Contains (Container : List;{"\n"}                   Item      : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>138/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Find (Container, Item) /= No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<p class="Indented4"><i>Paragraphs 139 and 140 were moved above.</i> <br /></p>

<MarginText>141/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in List;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>142/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate calls Process.<b>all</b> with a cursor that designates each node in Container, starting with the first node and moving the cursor as per the Next function. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>142.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The purpose of the tamper with cursors check is to prevent erroneous execution from the Position parameter of Process.<b>all</b> becoming invalid. This check takes place when the operations that tamper with the cursors of the container are called. The check cannot be made later (say in the body of Iterate), because that could cause the Position cursor to be invalid and potentially cause execution to become erroneous -- defeating the purpose of the check.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>142.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
See Iterate for vectors (<a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>) for a suggested implementation of the check. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>143/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reverse{"_"}Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in List;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>144/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterates over the nodes in Container as per procedure Iterate, except that elements are traversed in reverse order, starting with the last node and moving the cursor as per the Previous function.<br /></p>

<MarginText>144.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in List){"\n"}   return List{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>144.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each node in Container, starting with the first node and moving the cursor as per the Next function when used as a forward iterator, and starting with the last node and moving the cursor as per the Previous function when used as a reverse iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>144.3/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in List; Start : in Cursor){"\n"}   return List{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} (Start /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                     (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Start){"\n"}                        or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>144.4/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns a reversible iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each node in Container, starting with the node designated by Start and moving the cursor as per the Next function when used as a forward iterator, or moving the cursor as per the Previous function when used as a reverse iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>144.a/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Exits are allowed from the loops created using the iterator objects. In particular, to stop the iteration at a particular cursor, just add <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>144.b/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
exit when Cur = Stop;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>144.c/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
in the body of the loop (assuming that Cur is the loop parameter and Stop is the cursor that you want to stop at). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>145/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "{"<"}" of Generic{"_"}Sorting is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of element values. It should define a strict weak ordering relationship (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>); it should not modify Container. If the actual for "{"<"}" behaves in some other manner, the behavior of the subprograms of Generic{"_"}Sorting are unspecified. The number of times the subprograms of Generic{"_"}Sorting call "{"<"}" is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>146/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Sorted (Container : List) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if the elements are sorted smallest first as determined by the generic formal "{"<"}" operator; otherwise, Is{"_"}Sorted returns False. Any exception raised during evaluation of "{"<"}" is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>148/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Sort (Container : in out List){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>149/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reorders the nodes of Container such that the elements are sorted smallest first as determined by the generic formal "{"<"}" operator provided. The sort is stable. Any exception raised during evaluation of "{"<"}" is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>149.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Unlike array sorts, we do require stable sorts here. That's because algorithms in the merge sort family (as described by Knuth) can be both fast and stable. Such sorts use the extra memory as offered by the links to provide better performance.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>149.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Note that list sorts never copy elements; it is the nodes, not the elements, that are reordered. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>150/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Merge (Target  : in out List;{"\n"}                 Source  : in out List){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Target) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - Length (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                ((Length (Source) = 0 or else{"\n"}                   not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source)){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Result{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Source)'Old + Length (Target)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (Length (Source) = 0 and then{"\n"}                    Length (Target) = Result{"_"}Length));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>151/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0021-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Merge removes elements from Source and inserts them into Target; afterwards, Target contains the union of the elements that were initially in Source and Target; Source is left empty. If Target and Source are initially sorted smallest first, then Target is ordered smallest first as determined by the generic formal "{"<"}" operator; otherwise, the order of elements in Target is unspecified. Any exception raised during evaluation of "{"<"}" is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>151.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>It is a bounded error if either of the lists is unsorted, see below. The bounded error can be recovered by sorting Target after the merge call, or the lists can be pretested with Is{"_"}Sorted. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>151.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The nested package Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists.Stable provides a type Stable.List that represents a <i>stable</i> list, which is one that cannot grow and shrink. Such a list can be created by calling the Copy function, or by establishing a <i>stabilized view</i> of an ordinary list.<br /></p>

<MarginText>151.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The subprograms of package Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists that have a parameter or result of type List are included in the nested package Stable with the same specification, except that the following are omitted:<br /></p>

<MarginText>151.3/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<p class="Indented2">Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited, Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited, Assign, Move, Insert, Append, Prepend, Clear, Delete, Delete{"_"}First, Delete{"_"}Last, Splice, Swap{"_"}Links, and Reverse{"_"}Elements <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>151.a.1/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The names List and Cursor mean the types declared in the nested package in these subprogram specifications. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>151.a.2/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>The omitted routines are those that tamper with cursors or elements (or test that state). The model is that it is impossible to tamper with cursors or elements of a stable view since no such operations are included. Thus tampering checks are not needed for a stable view, and we omit the operations associated with those checks.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>151.a.3/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The Generic{"_"}Sorting generic is omitted entirely, as only function Is{"_"}Sorting does not tamper with cursors. It isn't useful enough by itself to include. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>151.4/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The operations of this package are equivalent to those for ordinary lists, except that the calls to Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited and Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited that occur in preconditions are replaced by False, and any that occur in postconditions are replaced by True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>151.5/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0439-1"]} />
<p>If a stable list is declared with the Base discriminant designating a pre-existing ordinary list, the stable list represents a stabilized view of the underlying ordinary list, and any operation on the stable list is reflected on the underlying ordinary list. While a stabilized view exists, any operation that tampers with elements performed on the underlying list is prohibited. The finalization of a stable list that provides such a view removes this restriction on the underlying ordinary list [(though some other restriction can exist due to other concurrent iterations or stabilized views)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>151.6/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0438-1"]} />
<p>If a stable list is declared without specifying Base, the object is necessarily initialized. The initializing expression of the stable list, [typically a call on Copy], determines the Length of the list. The Length of a stable list never changes after initialization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>151.b/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0438-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Initialization is required as the type is indefinite, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>152/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Calling Merge in an instance of Generic{"_"}Sorting with either Source or Target not ordered smallest first using the provided generic formal "{"<"}" operator is a bounded error. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised after Target is updated as described for Merge, or the operation works as defined.<br /></p>

<MarginText>152.1/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error for the actual function associated with a generic formal subprogram, when called as part of an operation of this package, to tamper with elements of any List parameter of the operation. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised, or the operation works as defined on the value of the List either prior to, or subsequent to, some or all of the modifications to the List.<br /></p>

<MarginText>152.2/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram declared in the visible part of Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists when the associated container has been finalized. If the operation takes Container as an <b>in out</b> parameter, then it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. Otherwise, the operation either proceeds as it would for an empty container, or it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. <br /></p>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>153/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A Cursor value is <i>invalid</i> if any of the following have occurred since it was created: <br /></p>

<MarginText>154/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The list that contains the element it designates has been finalized;<br /></li>
<MarginText>154.1/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<li>The list that contains the element it designates has been used as the Target of a call to Assign, or as the target of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>;<br /></li>
<MarginText>155/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<li>[The list that contains the element it designates has been used as the Source or Target of a call to Move;] or <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>155.a/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Move has been reworded in terms of Assign and Clear, which are covered by other bullets, so this text is redundant. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>156/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The element it designates has been removed from the list that previously contained the element. <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>156.a/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>The cursor modified by the four parameter Splice is not invalid, even though the element it designates has been removed from the source list, because that cursor has been modified to designate that element in the target list &ndash; the cursor no longer designates an element in the source list. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>156.b/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>This can happen directly via calls to Delete, Delete{"_"}Last, Clear, Splice with a Source parameter, and Merge; and indirectly via calls to Delete{"_"}First, Assign, and Move. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>157/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The result of "=" or Has{"_"}Element is unspecified if it is called with an invalid cursor parameter. Execution is erroneous if any other subprogram declared in Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists is called with an invalid cursor parameter. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>The list above is intended to be exhaustive. In other cases, a cursor value continues to designate its original element. For instance, cursor values survive the insertion and deletion of other nodes.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
While it is possible to check for these cases, in many cases the overhead necessary to make the check is substantial in time or space. Implementations are encouraged to check for as many of these cases as possible and raise Program{"_"}Error if detected. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>157.1/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Execution is erroneous if the list associated with the result of a call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized before the result object returned by the call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.c/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Each object of Reference{"_"}Type and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type probably contains some reference to the originating container. If that container is prematurely finalized (which is only possible via Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation, as accessibility checks prevent passing a container to Reference that will not live as long as the result), the finalization of the object of Reference{"_"}Type will try to access a nonexistent object. This is a normal case of a dangling pointer created by Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation; we have to explicitly mention it here as the pointer in question is not visible in the specification of the type. (This is the same reason we have to say this for invalid cursors.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>158/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>No storage associated with a doubly-linked list object shall be lost upon assignment or scope exit.<br /></p>

<MarginText>159/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The execution of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> for a list shall have the effect of copying the elements from the source list object to the target list object and changing the length of the target object to that of the source object.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>159.a/3_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0298-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>An assignment of a List is a &ldquo;deep&rdquo; copy; that is the elements are copied as well as the data structures. We say &ldquo;effect of&rdquo; in order to allow the implementation to avoid copying elements immediately if it wishes. For instance, an implementation that avoided copying until one of the containers is modified would be allowed. (Note that this implementation would require care, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>160/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists should be implemented similarly to a linked list. In particular, if <i>N</i> is the length of a list, then the worst-case time complexity of Element, Insert with Count=1, and Delete with Count=1 should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>160.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of Element, Insert with Count=1, and Delete with Count=1 for Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>160.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We do not mean to overly constrain implementation strategies here. However, it is important for portability that the performance of large containers has roughly the same factors on different implementations. If a program is moved to an implementation that takes <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>) time to access elements, that program could be unusable when the lists are large. We allow <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>) access because the proportionality constant and caching effects are likely to be larger than the log factor, and we don't want to discourage innovative implementations. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>161/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The worst-case time complexity of a call on procedure Sort of an instance of Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists.Generic{"_"}Sorting should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2), and the average time complexity should be better than <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>161.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>A call on procedure Sort of an instance of Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists.Generic{"_"}Sorting should have an average time complexity better than <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2) and worst case no worse than <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>161.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>In other words, we're requiring the use of a better than <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>{"*"}{"*"}2) sorting algorithm, such as Quicksort. No bubble sorts allowed! <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>162/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>162.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists.Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>162.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Usually that can be accomplished simply by moving the pointer(s) to the internal data structures from the Source container to the Target container. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>163/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If an exception is propagated from a list operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a list unless specified by the operation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>163.a/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>If an exception is propagated from a list operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a list unless specified by the operation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>163.b/2_A.18.3</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is important so that programs can recover from errors. But we don't want to require heroic efforts, so we just require documentation of cases where this can't be accomplished. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>164/5_A.18.3</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0442-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
NOTE   Sorting a list never copies elements, and is a stable sort (equal elements remain in the original order). This is different than sorting an array or vector, which will often copy elements, and hence is probably not a stable sort. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />

The generic package Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists is new. <br />
</Admonition>

<b></b> The Insert versions that return a Position parameter are now defined to return Position = Before if Count = 0. This was unspecified for Ada 2005; so this will only be inconsistent if an implementation did something else and a program depended on that something else &mdash; this should be very rare. <br />
</Admonition>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2005
