<MarginText>41/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>An object of type Map contains an expandable hash table, which is used to provide direct access to nodes. The <i>capacity</i> of an object of type Map is the maximum number of nodes that can be inserted into the hash table prior to it being automatically expanded.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>41.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The expected implementation for a Map uses a hash table which is grown when it is too small, with linked lists hanging off of each bucket. Note that in that implementation a cursor needs a back pointer to the Map object to implement iteration; that could either be in the nodes, or in the cursor object. To provide an average <i>O</i>(1) access time, capacity would typically equal the number of buckets in such an implementation, so that the average bucket linked list length would be no more than 1.0.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>41.b/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
There is no defined relationship between elements in a hashed map. Typically, iteration will return elements in the order that they are hashed in. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>42/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Two keys <i>K1</i> and <i>K2</i> are defined to be <i>equivalent</i> if Equivalent{"_"}Keys (<i>K1</i>, <i>K2</i>) returns True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>43/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function Hash is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular key value. For any two equivalent key values, the actual for Hash is expected to return the same value. If the actual for Hash behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Hash, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>43.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The implementation is not required to protect against Hash raising an exception, or returning random numbers, or any other &ldquo;bad&rdquo; behavior. It's not practical to do so, and a broken Hash function makes the container unusable.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>43.b/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The implementation can call Hash whenever it is needed; we don't want to specify how often that happens. The result must remain the same (this is logically a pure function), or the behavior is unspecified. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>44/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function Equivalent{"_"}Keys on Key{"_"}Type values is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of key values. It should define an equivalence relationship, that is, be reflexive, symmetric, and transitive. If the actual for Equivalent{"_"}Keys behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Equivalent{"_"}Keys, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>44.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>As with Hash, the implementation is not required to protect against Equivalent{"_"}Keys raising an exception or returning random results. Similarly, the implementation can call this operation whenever it is needed. The result must remain the same (this is a logically pure function), or the behavior is unspecified. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>45/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If the value of a key stored in a node of a map is changed other than by an operation in this package such that at least one of Hash or Equivalent{"_"}Keys give different results, the behavior of this package is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>45.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The implementation is not required to protect against changes to key values other than via the operations declared in the Hashed{"_"}Maps package.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>45.b/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
To see how this could happen, imagine an instance of Hashed{"_"}Maps where the key type is an access-to-variable type and Hash returns a value derived from the components of the designated object. Then, any operation that has a key value could modify those components and change the hash value:<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>45.c/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
Key (Map).Some{"_"}Component := New{"_"}Value;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>45.d/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
This is really a design error on the part of the user of the map; it shouldn't be possible to modify keys stored in a map. But we can't prevent this error anymore than we can prevent someone passing as Hash a random number generator. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>46/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Which nodes are the first node and the last node of a map, and which node is the successor of a given node, are unspecified, other than the general semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.4">A.18.4</a>.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>46.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Typically the first node will be the first node in the first bucket, the last node will be the last node in the last bucket, and the successor will be obtained by following the collision list, and going to the next bucket at the end of each bucket. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>46.1/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Empty (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := implementation-defined){"\n"}   return Map{"\n"}   with Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Capacity (Empty'Result) {">"}= Capacity and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}           Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>46.2/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns an empty map.<br /></p>

<MarginText>47/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Capacity (Container : Map) return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>48/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns the capacity of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>49/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                            Capacity  : in     Count{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                 or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Container.Capacity {">"}= Capacity;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>50/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reserve{"_"}Capacity allocates a new hash table such that the length of the resulting map can become at least the value Capacity without requiring an additional call to Reserve{"_"}Capacity, and is large enough to hold the current length of Container. Reserve{"_"}Capacity then rehashes the nodes in Container onto the new hash table. It replaces the old hash table with the new hash table, and then deallocates the old hash table. Any exception raised during allocation is propagated and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>51/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>51.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>This routine is used to preallocate the internal hash table to the specified capacity such that future Inserts do not require expansion of the hash table. Therefore, the implementation should allocate the needed memory to make that true at this point, even though the visible semantics could be preserved by waiting until enough elements are inserted.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>51.b/3_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
While Reserve{"_"}Capacity can be used to reduce the capacity of a map, we do not specify whether an implementation actually supports reduction of the capacity. Since the actual capacity can be anything greater than or equal to Capacity, an implementation never has to reduce the capacity.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>51.c/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Reserve{"_"}Capacity tampers with the cursors, as rehashing probably will change the order that elements are stored in the map. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>52/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Map){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Capacity (Container) = Capacity (Container)'Old and then{"\n"}                Length (Container) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>53/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">In addition to the semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.4">A.18.4</a>, Clear does not affect the capacity of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>53.1/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Map; Source : in Map){"\n"}      with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                      or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}           Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target) and then{"\n"}                   Capacity (Target) {">"}= Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>53.2/3_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">In addition to the semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.4">A.18.4</a>, if the length of Source is greater than the capacity of Target, Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Target, Length (Source)) is called before assigning any elements.<br /></p>

<MarginText>53.3/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Map; Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := 0){"\n"}   return Map{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}           Copy'Result.Capacity = (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}              Length (Source) else Capacity);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>53.4/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a map whose keys and elements are initialized from the keys and elements of Source.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>53.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>In:<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>53.b/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Map;{"\n"}                Source : in out Map);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>53.c/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The intended implementation is that the internal hash table of Target is first deallocated; then the internal hash table is removed from Source and moved to Target. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>54/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                  (if Inserted then{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length + 1{"\n"}                   else{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length)) and then{"\n"}                 Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>55/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">In addition to the semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.4">A.18.4</a>, if Length (Container) equals Capacity (Container), then Insert first calls Reserve{"_"}Capacity to increase the capacity of Container to some larger value.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Insert should only compare keys that hash to the same bucket in the hash table.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.b/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
We specify when Reserve{"_"}Capacity is called to bound the overhead of capacity expansion operations (which are potentially expensive). Moreover, expansion can be predicted by comparing Capacity(Map) to Length(Map). Since we don't specify by how much the hash table is expanded, this only can be used to predict the next expansion, not later ones.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.c/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>In:<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.d/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Exclude (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                   Key       : in     Key{"_"}Type);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.e/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Exclude should only compare keys that hash to the same bucket in the hash table.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.f/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>In:<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.g/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key{"_"}Type);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.h/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Delete should only compare keys that hash to the same bucket in the hash table. The node containing the element may be deallocated now, or it may be saved and reused later.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.i/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>In:<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.j/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Map) return Cursor;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.k/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
In a typical implementation, this will be the first node in the lowest numbered hash bucket that contains a node.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.l/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>In:<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.m/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Position  : Cursor) return Cursor;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.n/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
In a typical implementation, this will return the next node in a bucket; if Position is the last node in a bucket, this will return the first node in the next nonempty bucket.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.o/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A typical implementation will need to a keep a pointer at the map container in the cursor in order to implement this function. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.p/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>In:<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.q/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Map;{"\n"}               Key       : Key{"_"}Type) return Cursor;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.r/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Find should only compare keys that hash to the same bucket in the hash table.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>56/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent{"_"}Keys (Left, Right : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} (Left /= No{"_"}Element and then Right /= No{"_"}Element){"\n"}                      or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>57/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Equivalent{"_"}Keys (Key (Left), Key (Right)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>58/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent{"_"}Keys (Left  : Cursor;{"\n"}                          Right : Key{"_"}Type) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Left /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>59/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Equivalent{"_"}Keys (Key (Left), Right).<br /></p>

<MarginText>60/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent{"_"}Keys (Left  : Key{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                          Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Right /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>61/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Equivalent{"_"}Keys (Left, Key (Right)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>61.1/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Map){"\n"}   return Map{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>61.2/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each node in Container, starting with the first node and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>62/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If <i>N</i> is the length of a map, the average time complexity of the subprograms Element, Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find that take a key parameter should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>). The average time complexity of the subprograms that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1). The average time complexity of Reserve{"_"}Capacity should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.a/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The average time complexity of Element, Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations that take a key parameter for Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>). The average time complexity of the subprograms of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1). The average time complexity of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps.Reserve{"_"}Capacity should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.b/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We do not mean to overly constrain implementation strategies here. However, it is important for portability that the performance of large containers has roughly the same factors on different implementations. If a program is moved to an implementation for which Find is <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>), that program could be unusable when the maps are large. We allow <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>) access because the proportionality constant and caching effects are likely to be larger than the log factor, and we don't want to discourage innovative implementations. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.c/2_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The generic package Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.d/3_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Subprograms Assign and Copy are added to Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps. If an instance of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps is referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, and an entity <i>E</i> with the same <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.1#S0022">defining_identifier</a></code> as a new entity in Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps is defined in a package that is also referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, the entity <i>E</i> may no longer be use-visible, resulting in errors. This should be rare and is easily fixed if it does occur. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.e/3_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added iterator and indexing support to make hashed map containers more convenient to use. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.f/3_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a pragma Remote{"_"}Types so that containers can be used in distributed programs. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.g/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0339-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A number of new subprograms, types, and even a nested package were added to Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps to better support contracts and stable views. Therefore, a use clause conflict is possible; see the introduction of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/">Annex A</a> for more on this topic. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.h/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Maps now support named container aggregates, so <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-4/AA-4.3#S0106">aggregate</a></code> syntax can be used to create Maps.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.i/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0266-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The iterator for the container now can return a parallel iterator which can be used to process the container in parallel. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>62.j/5_A.18.5</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.6"></a>

## A.18.6  The Generic Package Containers.Ordered_Maps


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
with Ada.Iterator{"_"}Interfaces;{"\n"}generic{"\n"}   type Key{"_"}Type is private;{"\n"}   type Element{"_"}Type is private;{"\n"}   with function "{"<"}" (Left, Right : Key{"_"}Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}   with function "=" (Left, Right : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}package Ada.Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps{"\n"}   with Preelaborate, Remote{"_"}Types,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized is{"\n"}

<MarginText>55/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Two keys <i>K1</i> and <i>K2</i> are <i>equivalent</i> if both <i>K1</i> {"<"} <i>K2</i> and <i>K2</i> {"<"} <i>K1</i> return False, using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator for keys. Function Equivalent{"_"}Keys returns True if Left and Right are equivalent, and False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>56/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0044-1"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "{"<"}" on Key{"_"}Type values is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of key values. It should define a strict weak ordering relationship (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>). If the actual for "{"<"}" behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call "{"<"}" and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>56.a/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The implementation is not required to protect against "{"<"}" raising an exception, or returning random results, or any other &ldquo;bad&rdquo; behavior. It's not practical to do so, and a broken "{"<"}" function makes the container unusable.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>56.b/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The implementation can call "{"<"}" whenever it is needed; we don't want to specify how often that happens. The result must remain the same (this is a logically pure function), or the behavior is unspecified. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>57/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If the value of a key stored in a map is changed other than by an operation in this package such that at least one of "{"<"}" or "=" give different results, the behavior of this package is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>57.a/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The implementation is not required to protect against changes to key values other than via the operations declared in the Ordered{"_"}Maps package.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>57.b/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
To see how this could happen, imagine an instance of Ordered{"_"}Maps package where the key type is an access-to-variable type and "{"<"}" returns a value derived from comparing the components of the designated objects. Then, any operation that has a key value (even if the key value is constant) could modify those components and change the result of "{"<"}":<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>57.c/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
Key (Map).Some{"_"}Component := New{"_"}Value;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>57.d/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
This is really a design error on the part of the user of the map; it shouldn't be possible to modify keys stored in a map such that "{"<"}" changes. But we can't prevent this error anymore than we can prevent someone passing as "{"<"}" a routine that produces random answers. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>58/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The <i>first node</i> of a nonempty map is the one whose key is less than the key of all the other nodes in the map. The <i>last node</i> of a nonempty map is the one whose key is greater than the key of all the other elements in the map. The <i>successor</i> of a node is the node with the smallest key that is larger than the key of the given node. The <i>predecessor</i> of a node is the node with the largest key that is smaller than the key of the given node. All comparisons are done using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator for keys.<br /></p>

<MarginText>58.1/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Map){"\n"}   return Map{"\n"}   with Post ={">"}{"\n"}      Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}      not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}      not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>58.2/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a map whose keys and elements are initialized from the corresponding keys and elements of Source.<br /></p>

<CodeBlock language="ada">

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>60/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Container is empty, Delete{"_"}First has no effect. Otherwise, the node designated by First (Container) is removed from Container. Delete{"_"}First tampers with the cursors of Container.<br /></p>

procedure Reverse{"_"}Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Map;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>94/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterates over the nodes in Container as per procedure Iterate, with the difference that the nodes are traversed in predecessor order, starting with the last node.<br /></p>

<MarginText>94.1/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Map){"\n"}   return Map{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>94.2/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each node in Container, starting with the first node and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, and starting with the last node and moving the cursor according to the predecessor relation when used as a reverse iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>94.3/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Map; Start : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Map{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Start /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Start){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>94.4/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns a reversible iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each node in Container, starting with the node designated by Start and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, or moving the cursor according to the predecessor relation when used as a reverse iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>94.a/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Exits are allowed from the loops created using the iterator objects. In particular, to stop the iteration at a particular cursor, just add <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>94.b/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
exit when Cur = Stop;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>94.c/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
in the body of the loop (assuming that Cur is the loop parameter and Stop is the cursor that you want to stop at). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>95/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If <i>N</i> is the length of a map, then the worst-case time complexity of the Element, Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations that take a key parameter should be <i>O</i>((log <i>N</i>){"*"}{"*"}2) or better. The worst-case time complexity of the subprograms that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.a/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of Element, Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations that take a key parameter for Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps should be <i>O</i>((log <i>N</i>){"*"}{"*"}2) or better. The worst-case time complexity of the subprograms of Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.b/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>A balanced (red-black) tree for keys has <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>) worst-case performance. Note that a <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>) worst-case implementation (like a list) would be wrong. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.c/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We do not mean to overly constrain implementation strategies here. However, it is important for portability that the performance of large containers has roughly the same factors on different implementations. If a program is moved to an implementation that takes <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>) to find elements, that program could be unusable when the maps are large. We allow the extra log <i>N</i> factors because the proportionality constant and caching effects are likely to be larger than the log factor, and we don't want to discourage innovative implementations. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.d/2_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The generic package Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.e/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Subprograms Assign and Copy are added to Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps. If an instance of Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps is referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, and an entity <i>E</i> with the same <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.1#S0022">defining_identifier</a></code> as a new entity in Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps is defined in a package that is also referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, the entity <i>E</i> may no longer be use-visible, resulting in errors. This should be rare and is easily fixed if it does occur. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.f/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added iterator and indexing support to make ordered map containers more convenient to use. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.g/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Redefined "{"<"}" actuals to require a strict weak ordering; the old definition allowed indeterminant comparisons that would not have worked in a container.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.h/3_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a pragma Remote{"_"}Types so that containers can be used in distributed programs. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.i/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0339-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A number of new subprograms, types, and even a nested package were added to Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps to better support contracts and stable views. Therefore, a use clause conflict is possible; see the introduction of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/">Annex A</a> for more on this topic. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.j/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Maps now support named container aggregates, so <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-4/AA-4.3#S0106">aggregate</a></code> syntax can be used to create Maps.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

The iterator for the entire container now can return a parallel iterator which can be used to process the container in parallel. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.l/5_A.18.6</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.7"></a>

## A.18.7  Sets

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic packages Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets and Containers.Ordered{"_"}Sets provide private types Set and Cursor, and a set of operations for each type. A set container allows elements of an arbitrary type to be stored without duplication. A hashed set uses a hash function to organize elements, while an ordered set orders its element per a specified relation. <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0299-1"]} />
<p>This subclause describes the declarations that are common to both kinds of sets. See <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.8">A.18.8</a> for a description of the semantics specific to Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets and <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.9">A.18.9</a> for a description of the semantics specific to Containers.Ordered{"_"}Sets. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>3/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "=" on Element{"_"}Type values is expected to define a reflexive and symmetric relationship and return the same result value each time it is called with a particular pair of values. If it behaves in some other manner, the function "=" on set values returns an unspecified value. The exact arguments and number of calls of this generic formal function by the function "=" on set values are unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>If the actual function for "=" is not symmetric and consistent, the result returned by the "=" for Set objects cannot be predicted. The implementation is not required to protect against "=" raising an exception, or returning random results, or any other &ldquo;bad&rdquo; behavior. And it can call "=" in whatever manner makes sense. But note that only the result of "=" for Set objects is unspecified; other subprograms are not allowed to break if "=" is bad (they aren't expected to use "="). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>4/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The type Set is used to represent sets. The type Set needs finalization (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-7/AA-7.6">7.6</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>5/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A set contains elements. Set cursors designate elements. There exists an equivalence relation on elements, whose definition is different for hashed sets and ordered sets. A set never contains two or more equivalent elements. The <i>length</i> of a set is the number of elements it contains.<br /></p>

<MarginText>6/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Each nonempty set has two particular elements called the <i>first element</i> and the <i>last element</i> (which may be the same). Each element except for the last element has a <i>successor element</i>. If there are no other intervening operations, starting with the first element and repeatedly going to the successor element will visit each element in the set exactly once until the last element is reached. The exact definition of these terms is different for hashed sets and ordered sets.<br /></p>

<MarginText>7/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>[Some operations check for &ldquo;tampering with cursors&rdquo; of a container because they depend on the set of elements of the container remaining constant and  on elements of the container not being replaced.] When tampering with cursors is <i>prohibited</i> for a particular set object <i>S</i>, Program{"_"}Error is propagated by the finalization of <i>S</i>[, as well as by a call that passes <i>S</i> to certain of the operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.a/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Note that Replace{"_"}Element tampers with cursors because it might delete and reinsert the element if it moves in the set. That could change the order of iteration, which is what this check is designed to prevent. Replace also tampers with cursors, as it is defined in terms of Replace{"_"}Element.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.b/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
These inclusions mean that there are no operations that would tamper with elements that do not tamper with cursors. As such, we do not define tampering with elements at all for set containers. Earlier versions of Ada did so just so the description of subprograms are the same between containers, but since we've changed those to pre- and postconditions which are necessarily specific to each container, there no longer seems to be any reason to define tampering with elements for sets. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<p><i>Paragraphs 8 through 14 are removed as preconditions now describe these rules.</i> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>10.a/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>We don't need to explicitly mention <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>, because that finalizes the target object as part of the operation, and finalization of an object is already defined as tampering with cursors. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>15/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Empty{"_"}Set represents the empty Set object. It has a length of 0. If an object of type Set is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as Empty{"_"}Set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>16/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>No{"_"}Element represents a cursor that designates no element. If an object of type Cursor is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>17/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0434-1"]} />
<p>The primitive "=" operator for type Cursor returns True if both cursors are No{"_"}Element, or designate the same element in the same container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>17.a/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0434-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>&ldquo;The primitive "=" operator&rdquo; is the one with two parameters of type Cursor which returns Boolean. We're not talking about some other (hidden) primitive function named "=". <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Execution of the default implementation of the Input, Output, Read, or Write attribute of type Cursor raises Program{"_"}Error.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>A cursor will probably be implemented in terms of one or more access values, and the effects of streaming access values is unspecified. Rather than letting the user stream junk by accident, we mandate that streaming of cursors raise Program{"_"}Error by default. The attributes can always be specified if there is a need to support streaming. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>Set'Write for a Set object <i>S</i> writes Length(<i>S</i>) elements of the set to the stream. It may also write additional information about the set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>18.2/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>Set'Read reads the representation of a set from the stream, and assigns to <i>Item</i> a set with the same length and elements as was written by Set'Write.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.b/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Streaming more elements than the container length is wrong. For implementation implications of this rule, see the Implementation Note in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18.3/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has{"_"}Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>18.4/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Position designates an element, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.c/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>This function might not detect cursors that designate deleted elements; such cursors are invalid (see below) and the result of calling Has{"_"}Element with an invalid cursor is unspecified (but not erroneous). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>18.5/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has{"_"}Element (Container : Set; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>18.6/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Position designates an element in Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.d/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>If Position is No{"_"}Element, Has{"_"}Element returns False. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>19/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>20/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Left and Right denote the same set object, then the function returns True. If Left and Right have different lengths, then the function returns False. Otherwise, for each element <i>E</i> in Left, the function returns False if an element equal to <i>E</i> (using the generic formal equality operator) is not present in Right. If the function has not returned a result after checking all of the elements, it returns True. Any exception raised during evaluation of element equality is propagated. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>20.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality function is unspecified for all of the operations that use it in this package, so an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Specifically, there is no requirement to call the formal equality additional times once the answer has been determined. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>21/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent{"_"}Sets (Left, Right : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>22/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Left and Right denote the same set object, then the function returns True. If Left and Right have different lengths, then the function returns False. Otherwise, for each element <i>E</i> in Left, the function returns False if an element equivalent to <i>E</i> is not present in Right. If the function has not returned a result after checking all of the elements, it returns True. Any exception raised during evaluation of element equivalence is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>22.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Set) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>22.2/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with cursors is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>22.a/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Various contracts elsewhere in this specification require that this function be implemented with synchronized data. Moreover, it is possible for tampering to be prohibited by multiple operations (sequentially or in parallel). Therefore, tampering needs to be implemented with an atomic or protected counter. The counter is initialized to zero, and is incremented when tampering is prohibited, and decremented when leaving an area that prohibited tampering. Function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited returns True if the counter is nonzero. (Note that any case where the result is not well-defined for one task is incorrect use of shared variables and would be erroneous by the rules of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-9/AA-9.10">9.10</a>, so no special protection is needed to read the counter.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>23/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To{"_"}Set (New{"_"}Item : Element{"_"}Type) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (To{"_"}Set'Result) = 1 and then{"\n"}              not Tampering{"_"}with{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (To{"_"}Set'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>24/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />

<MarginText>32.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Set;{"\n"}                  Position  : Cursor) return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>32.2/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Element returns the element designated by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>33/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace{"_"}Element (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                           Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           New{"_"}item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>34/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0196-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Replace{"_"}Element assigns New{"_"}Item to the element designated by Position. Any exception raised by the assignment is propagated. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace{"_"}Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>34.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The final assignment may require that the node of the element be moved in the Set's data structures. That could mean that implementing this operation exactly as worded above could require the overhead of searching twice. Implementations are encouraged to avoid this extra overhead when possible, by prechecking if the old element is equivalent to the new one, by inserting a placeholder node while checking for an equivalent element, and similar optimizations.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>34.b/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The cursor still designates the same element after this operation; only the value of that element has changed. Cursors cannot include information about the relative position of an element in a Set (as they must survive insertions and deletions of other elements), so this should not pose an implementation hardship. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>35/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36/5_A.18.7</MarginText>

<p class="Indented4">Query{"_"}Element calls Process.<b>all</b> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of the set that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.2/5_A.18.7</MarginText>

<MarginText>36.5/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>36.a/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>It is expected that Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>36.6/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant{"_"}Reference (Container : aliased in Set;{"\n"}                             Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36.7/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Constant{"_"}Indexing and Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a set given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.8/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Constant{"_"}Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant{"_"}Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>36.9/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Set; Source : in Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>36.10/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the elements of Source are copied to Target as for an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> assigning Source to Target. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>36.b/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This routine exists for compatibility with the bounded set containers. For an unbounded set, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave identically. For a bounded set, := will raise an exception if the container capacities are different, while Assign will not raise an exception if there is enough room in the target. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>37/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                Source : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                    Length (Target) = Length (Source'Old) and then{"\n"}                    Length (Source) = 0);{"\n"}

<MarginText>38/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the operation is equivalent to Assign (Target, Source) followed by Clear (Source).<br /></p>

<MarginText>39/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                  (if Inserted then{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length + 1{"\n"}                   else{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>40/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert checks if an element equivalent to New{"_"}Item is already present in Container. If a match is found, Inserted is set to False and Position designates the matching element. Otherwise, Insert adds New{"_"}Item to Container; Inserted is set to True and Position designates the newly-inserted element. Any exception raised during allocation is propagated and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>41/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old + 1;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>42/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert inserts New{"_"}Item into Container as per the four-parameter Insert, with the difference that if an element equivalent to New{"_"}Item is already in the set, then Constraint{"_"}Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>42.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This is equivalent to: <br />
</Admonition>

<MarginText>42.b/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
declare{"\n"}  Inserted : Boolean; C : Cursor;{"\n"}begin{"\n"}  Insert (Container, New{"_"}Item, C, Inserted);{"\n"}  if not Inserted then{"\n"}     raise Constraint{"_"}Error;{"\n"}  end if;{"\n"}end;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>42.c/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">

</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>43/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginText>44/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />

<CodeBlock language="ada">

<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginText>52/5_A.18.7</MarginText>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>52.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The check on Position checks that the cursor does not belong to some other set. This check implies that a reference to the set is included in the cursor value. This wording is not meant to require detection of dangling cursors; such cursors are defined to be invalid, which means that execution is erroneous, and any result is allowed (including not raising an exception). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>53/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Union (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                 Source : in     Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Target) {"<"}= Length (Target)'Old + Length (Source);{"\n"}

<MarginText>54/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Union inserts into Target the elements of Source that are not equivalent to some element already in Target.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>54.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>If the objects are the same, the result is the same as the original object. The implementation needs to take care so that aliasing effects do not make the result trash; Union (S, S); must work. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>55/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginText>56/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a set comprising all of the elements of Left, and the elements of Right that are not equivalent to some element of Left.<br /></p>
