<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Symmetric{"_"}Difference (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                                Source : in     Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Target) {"<"}= Length (Target)'Old + Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>66/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, then Symmetric{"_"}Difference clears Target. Otherwise, it deletes from Target the elements that are equivalent to some element of Source, and inserts into Target the elements of Source that are not equivalent to some element of Target.<br /></p>

<MarginText>67/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Symmetric{"_"}Difference (Left, Right : Set) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (Symmetric{"_"}Difference'Result) {"<"}= {"\n"}                   Length (Left) + Length (Right) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited ({"\n"}                   Symmetric{"_"}Difference'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>68/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a set comprising the elements of Left that are not equivalent to some element of Right, and the elements of Right that are not equivalent to some element of Left.<br /></p>

<MarginText>69/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Overlap (Left, Right : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>70/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If an element of Left is equivalent to some element of Right, then Overlap returns True. Otherwise, it returns False.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>70.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This operation is commutative. If Overlap returns False, the two sets are disjoint. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>71/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Subset (Subset : Set;{"\n"}                    Of{"_"}Set : Set) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>72/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If an element of Subset is not equivalent to some element of Of{"_"}Set, then Is{"_"}Subset returns False. Otherwise, it returns True.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>72.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This operation is not commutative, so we use parameter names that make it clear in named notation which set is which. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>73/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Set) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is{"_"}Empty (Container){"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, First'Result){"\n"}                 else First'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>74/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Length (Container) = 0, then First returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, First returns a cursor that designates the first element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then Next'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>76/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a cursor that designates the successor of the element designated by Position. If Position designates the last element, then No{"_"}Element is returned. If Position equals No{"_"}Element, then No{"_"}Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>76.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Next (Container : Set;{"\n"}               Position  : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then Next'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 elsif Next'Result = No{"_"}Element then{"\n"}                   Position = Last (Container){"\n"}                 else Has{"_"}Element (Container, Next'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>76.2/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a cursor designating the successor of the node designated by Position in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>77/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>78/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Next (Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>78.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Next (Container : in     Set;{"\n"}                Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>78.2/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Position := Next (Container, Position).<br /></p>

<MarginText>79/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0004-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<MarginText>80/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Set;{"\n"}               Item      : Element{"_"}Type) return Cursor{"\n"}      with Post ={">"} (if Find'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>81/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Length (Container) equals 0, then Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, Find checks if an element equivalent to Item is present in Container. If a match is found, a cursor designating the matching element is returned; otherwise, No{"_"}Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Contains (Container : Set;{"\n"}                   Item      : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>82.1/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0004-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Find (Container, Item) /= No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<p class="Indented4"><i>Paragraphs 83 and 84 were moved above.</i> <br /></p>

<MarginText>85/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Set;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>86/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate calls Process.<b>all</b> with a cursor that designates each element in Container, starting with the first element and moving the cursor according to the successor relation. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>86.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The &ldquo;tamper with cursors&rdquo; check takes place when the operations that insert or delete elements, and so on are called.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>86.b/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
See Iterate for vectors (<a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>) for a suggested implementation of the check. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>87/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Both Containers.Hashed{"_"}Set and Containers.Ordered{"_"}Set declare a nested generic package Generic{"_"}Keys, which provides operations that allow set manipulation in terms of a key (typically, a portion of an element) instead of a complete element. The formal function Key of Generic{"_"}Keys extracts a key value from an element. It is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular element. The behavior of Generic{"_"}Keys is unspecified if Key behaves in some other manner.<br /></p>

<MarginText>88/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A key is expected to unambiguously determine a single equivalence class for elements. The behavior of Generic{"_"}Keys is unspecified if the formal parameters of this package behave in some other manner.<br /></p>

<MarginText>89/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Key (Position : Cursor) return Key{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>90/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Key (Element (Position)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>90.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Key (Container : Set;{"\n"}              Position : Cursor) return Key{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>90.2/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Key (Element (Container, Position)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>91/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The subprograms in package Generic{"_"}Keys named Contains, Find, Element, Delete, and Exclude, are equivalent to the corresponding subprograms in the parent package, with the difference that the Key parameter is used to locate an element in the set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>92/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                   Key       : in     Key{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                   New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Length (Container) = Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>93/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Replace{"_"}Element (Container, Find (Container, Key), New{"_"}Item).<br /></p>

<MarginText>94/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update{"_"}Element{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key{"\n"}  (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}   Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure{"\n"}                                 (Element : in out Element{"_"}Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>95/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Update{"_"}Element{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key uses Key to save the key value <i>K</i> of the element designated by Position. Update{"_"}Element{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key then calls Process.<b>all</b> with that element as the argument. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated. After Process.<b>all</b> returns, Update{"_"}Element{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key checks if <i>K</i> determines the same equivalence class as that for the new element; if not, the element is removed from the set and Program{"_"}Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>95.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>The key check ensures that the invariants of the set are preserved by the modification. The &ldquo;tampers with the elements&rdquo; check prevents data loss (if Element{"_"}Type is by-copy) or erroneous execution (if element type is unconstrained and indefinite). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">If Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<b>all</b> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>This means that the elements cannot be directly allocated from the heap; it must be possible to change the discriminants of the element in place. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Reference{"_"}Type (Element : not null access Element{"_"}Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit{"_"}Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} (raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.2/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">The type Reference{"_"}Type needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.3/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<MarginText>96.4/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key (Container : aliased in out Set;{"\n"}                                   Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.5/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspect) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a set given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.6/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reference{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key uses Key to save the key value <i>K</i>; then returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key exists and has not been finalized. When the object returned by Reference{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key is finalized, a check is made if <i>K</i> determines the same equivalence class as that for the new element; if not, the element is removed from the set and Program{"_"}Error is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.7/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant{"_"}Reference (Container : aliased in Set;{"\n"}                             Key       : in Key{"_"}Type){"\n"}   return Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Find (Container, Key) /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.8/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspect) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a set given a key value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.9/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Constant{"_"}Reference (Container, Find (Container, Key)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.10/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key (Container : aliased in out Set;{"\n"}                                   Key       : in Key{"_"}Type){"\n"}   return Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Find (Container, Key) /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.11/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspect) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a set given a key value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.12/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Reference{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key (Container, Find (Container, Key)). <br /></p>

<MarginText>96.13/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The nested package Stable provides a type Stable.Set that represents a <i>stable</i> set, which is one that cannot grow and shrink. Such a set can be created by calling the Copy function, or by establishing a <i>stabilized view</i> of an ordinary set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.14/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The subprograms of the set package that have a parameter or result of type Set are included in the nested package Stable with the same specification, except that the following are omitted:<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.15/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<p class="Indented2">Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited, Assign, Move, Insert, Include, Clear, Delete, Exclude, Replace, Replace{"_"}Element, procedures Union, Intersection, Difference, and Symmetric{"_"}Difference, (for Ordered{"_"}sets) Delete{"_"}First and Delete{"_"}Last, and (for Hashed{"_"}sets) Reserve{"_"}Capacity <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a.1/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>The Generic{"_"}Keys package is not included in the Stable package. The functions Union, Intersection, Difference, and Symmetric{"_"}Difference are included in the Stable package. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a.2/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The names Set and Cursor mean the types declared in the nested package in these subprogram specifications. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a.3/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>The omitted routines are those that tamper with cursors (or test that state). The model is that it is impossible to tamper with cursors of a stable view since no such operations are included. Thus tampering checks are not needed for a stable view, and we omit the operations associated with those checks. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.16/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The operations of this package are equivalent to those for ordinary sets, except that the calls to Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited that occur in preconditions are replaced by False, and any that occur in postconditions are replaced by True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.17/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0439-1"]} />
<p>If a stable set is declared with the Base discriminant designating a pre-existing ordinary set, the stable set represents a stabilized view of the underlying ordinary set, and any operation on the stable set is reflected on the underlying ordinary set. While a stabilized view exists, any operation that tampers with cursors performed on the underlying set is prohibited. The finalization of a stable set that provides such a view removes this restriction on the underlying ordinary set [(though some other restriction can exist due to other concurrent iterations or stabilized views)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.18/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0438-1"]} />
<p>If a stable set is declared without specifying Base, the object is necessarily initialized. The initializing expression of the stable set, [typically a call on Copy], determines the Length of the set. The Length of a stable set never changes after initialization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.b/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0438-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Initialization is required as the type is indefinite, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>96.19/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error for the actual function associated with a generic formal subprogram, when called as part of an operation of a set package, to tamper with elements of any set parameter of the operation. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised, or the operation works as defined on the value of the set either prior to, or subsequent to, some or all of the modifications to the set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>96.20/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram declared in the visible part of a set package when the associated container has been finalized. If the operation takes Container as an <b>in out</b> parameter, then it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. Otherwise, the operation either proceeds as it would for an empty container, or it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. <br /></p>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>97/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>A Cursor value is <i>invalid</i> if any of the following have occurred since it was created: <br /></p>

<MarginText>98/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The set that contains the element it designates has been finalized;<br /></li>
<MarginText>98.1/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<li>The set that contains the element it designates has been used as the Target of a call to Assign, or as the target of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>;<br /></li>
<MarginText>99/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<li>The set that contains the element it designates has been used as the Source or Target of a call to Move; or<br /></li>
<MarginText>100/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<li>The element it designates has been removed from the set that previously contained the element. <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>100.a/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>This can happen directly via calls to Clear, Exclude, Delete, and Update{"_"}Element{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key, and indirectly via calls to procedures Intersection, Difference, and Symmetric{"_"}Difference. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>101/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The result of "=" or Has{"_"}Element is unspecified if these functions are called with an invalid cursor parameter. Execution is erroneous if any other subprogram declared in Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets or Containers.Ordered{"_"}Sets is called with an invalid cursor parameter.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>101.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>The list above is intended to be exhaustive. In other cases, a cursor value continues to designate its original element. For instance, cursor values survive the insertion and deletion of other elements.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>101.b/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
While it is possible to check for these cases, in many cases the overhead necessary to make the check is substantial in time or space. Implementations are encouraged to check for as many of these cases as possible and raise Program{"_"}Error if detected. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>101.1/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Execution is erroneous if the set associated with the result of a call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized before the result object returned by the call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>101.c/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Each object of Reference{"_"}Type and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type probably contains some reference to the originating container. If that container is prematurely finalized (which is only possible via Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation, as accessibility checks prevent passing a container to Reference that will not live as long as the result), the finalization of the object of Reference{"_"}Type will try to access a nonexistent object. This is a normal case of a dangling pointer created by Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation; we have to explicitly mention it here as the pointer in question is not visible in the specification of the type. (This is the same reason we have to say this for invalid cursors.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>102/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>No storage associated with a set object shall be lost upon assignment or scope exit.<br /></p>

<MarginText>103/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The execution of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> for a set shall have the effect of copying the elements from the source set object to the target set object and changing the length of the target object to that of the source object.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>103.a/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0298-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>An assignment of a Set is a &ldquo;deep&rdquo; copy; that is the elements are copied as well as the data structures. We say &ldquo;effect of&rdquo; in order to allow the implementation to avoid copying elements immediately if it wishes. For instance, an implementation that avoided copying until one of the containers is modified would be allowed. (Note that this implementation would require care, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>104/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>104.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Move for sets should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>104.b/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Usually that can be accomplished simply by moving the pointer(s) to the internal data structures from the Source container to the Target container. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>105/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If an exception is propagated from a set operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a set unless specified by the operation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.a/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>If an exception is propagated from a set operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a set unless specified by the operation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.b/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is important so that programs can recover from errors. But we don't want to require heroic efforts, so we just require documentation of cases where this can't be accomplished. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.c/2_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
This description of sets is new; the extensions are documented with the specific packages. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.d/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added reference support to make set containers more convenient to use. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.e/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added procedure Assign; the extension and incompatibility is documented with the specific packages.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.f/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Generalized the definition of Move. Specified which elements are read/written by stream attributes.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.g/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover tampering by generic actual subprograms.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.h/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a Bounded (Run-Time) Error to cover access to finalized set containers.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.i/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Revised the definition of invalid cursors to cover missing (and new) cases.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.j/3_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Defined when a container prohibits tampering in order to more clearly define where the check is made and the exception raised. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.k/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Procedures Union, Intersection, Difference, and Symmeteric{"_"}Difference are now defined to tamper with the cursors of the Target parameter. A program which attempts to use one of these operations while tampering is prohibited will raise Program{"_"}Error. However, since the operations do modify the container, the effects would have been unpredictable, so this change will likely fix bugs. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.l/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0196-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Replace{"_"}Element is now defined such that it can be used concurrently so long as it operates on different elements. This allows some container operations to be used in parallel without separate synchronization. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.m/4_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0110-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Clarified that tampering checks precede all other checks made by a subprogram (but come after those associated with the call).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>105.n/5_A.18.7</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.8"></a>

## A.18.8  The Generic Package Containers.Hashed_Sets


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
with Ada.Iterator{"_"}Interfaces;{"\n"}generic{"\n"}   type Element{"_"}Type is private;{"\n"}   with function Hash (Element : Element{"_"}Type) return Hash{"_"}Type;{"\n"}   with function Equivalent{"_"}Elements (Left, Right : Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}                 return Boolean;{"\n"}   with function "=" (Left, Right : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}package Ada.Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets{"\n"}   with Preelaborate, Remote{"_"}Types,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized is{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>2.a/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>For discussion on the reasons and meaning of the specifications of the Global and Nonblocking aspects in this generic package, see the notes on the equivalent operations in the specification of the Containers.Vectors package (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>3/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0212-1", "AI12-0339-1", "AI12-0399-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   type Set is tagged private{"\n"}      with Constant{"_"}Indexing ={">"} Constant{"_"}Reference,{"\n"}           Default{"_"}Iterator  ={">"} Iterate,{"\n"}           Iterator{"_"}Element  ={">"} Element{"_"}Type,{"\n"}           Iterator{"_"}View     ={">"} Stable.Set,{"\n"}           Aggregate         ={">"} (Empty       ={">"} Empty,{"\n"}                                 Add{"_"}Unnamed ={">"} Include),{"\n"}           Stable{"_"}Properties ={">"} (Length,{"\n"}                                 Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited),{"\n"}           Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"}{"\n"}              Length (Set) = 0 and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Set)),{"\n"}           Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Unlike a Vector, the Stable{"_"}Properties of a Hashed{"_"}Set do not include the Capacity. If we had included it, some of the otherwise shared definitions would need different postconditions for Hashed{"_"}Sets and Ordered{"_"}Sets. If we were starting these containers from scratch, we probably would have approached the sharing of definitions differently so that we could avoid issues like this, but a major reorganization of this existing material would be too much change. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

   procedure Move (Target : in out Set;{"\n"}                   Source : in out Set){"\n"}      with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                      or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                   (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                      or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}           Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                      Length (Target) = Length (Source'Old) and then{"\n"}                      Length (Source) = 0);{"\n"}

   procedure Insert (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                     New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                     Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                     Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}      with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                      or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                   (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                      or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}           Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                      Original{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                         Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                    begin{"\n"}                      Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                     (if Inserted then{"\n"}                        Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length + 1{"\n"}                      else{"\n"}                        Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length)) and then{"\n"}                    Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

<MarginText>63/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>An object of type Set contains an expandable hash table, which is used to provide direct access to elements. The <i>capacity</i> of an object of type Set is the maximum number of elements that can be inserted into the hash table prior to it being automatically expanded.<br /></p>

<MarginText>64/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Two elements <i>E1</i> and <i>E2</i> are defined to be <i>equivalent</i> if Equivalent{"_"}Elements (<i>E1</i>, <i>E2</i>) returns True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>65/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function Hash is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular element value. For any two equivalent elements, the actual for Hash is expected to return the same value. If the actual for Hash behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Hash, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>66/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function Equivalent{"_"}Elements is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of Element values. It should define an equivalence relationship, that is, be reflexive, symmetric, and transitive. If the actual for Equivalent{"_"}Elements behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Equivalent{"_"}Elements, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>66.1/3_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<p>If the actual function for the generic formal function "=" returns True for any pair of nonequivalent elements, then the behavior of the container function "=" is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>67/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If the value of an element stored in a set is changed other than by an operation in this package such that at least one of Hash or Equivalent{"_"}Elements give different results, the behavior of this package is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>67.a/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>See <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">A.18.5</a>, &ldquo;<a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">The Generic Package Containers.Hashed_Maps</a>&rdquo; for a suggested implementation, and for justification of the restrictions regarding Hash and Equivalent{"_"}Elements. Note that sets only need to store elements, not key/element pairs. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>68/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Which elements are the first element and the last element of a set, and which element is the successor of a given element, are unspecified, other than the general semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>.<br /></p>

<MarginText>68.1/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Empty (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := implementation-defined){"\n"}   return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Capacity (Empty'Result) {">"}= Capacity and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}           Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>68.2/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns an empty set.<br /></p>

<MarginText>69/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Capacity (Container : Set) return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>70/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns the capacity of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>71/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                            Capacity  : in     Count{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Container.Capacity {">"}= Capacity;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>72/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reserve{"_"}Capacity allocates a new hash table such that the length of the resulting set can become at least the value Capacity without requiring an additional call to Reserve{"_"}Capacity, and is large enough to hold the current length of Container. Reserve{"_"}Capacity then rehashes the elements in Container onto the new hash table. It replaces the old hash table with the new hash table, and then deallocates the old hash table. Any exception raised during allocation is propagated and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>73/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>73.a/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Reserve{"_"}Capacity tampers with the cursors, as rehashing probably will change the relationships of the elements in Container. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>74/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Capacity (Container) = Capacity (Container)'Old and then{"\n"}                Length (Container) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">In addition to the semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, Clear does not affect the capacity of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.1/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Set; Source : in Set){"\n"}      with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                      or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}           Post ={">"} Length (Source) = Length (Target) and then{"\n"}                   Capacity (Target) {">"}= Length (Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75.2/3_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">In addition to the semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, if the length of Source is greater than the capacity of Target, Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Target, Length (Source)) is called before assigning any elements.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75.3/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Set; Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := 0){"\n"}   return Set{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}           Copy'Result.Capacity = (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}              Length (Source) else Capacity);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>75.4/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a set whose elements are initialized from the elements of Source.<br /></p>

<MarginText>76/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                  New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Length (Container) {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - 1{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) and then{"\n"}                  (if Inserted then{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length + 1{"\n"}                   else{"\n"}                     Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length)) and then{"\n"}                 Capacity (Container) {">"}= Length (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>77/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">In addition to the semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, if Length (Container) equals Capacity (Container), then Insert first calls Reserve{"_"}Capacity to increase the capacity of Container to some larger value.<br /></p>

<MarginText>78/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First (Container : Set) return Cursor;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>79/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Length (Container) = 0, then First returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, First returns a cursor that designates the first hashed element in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>80/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent{"_"}Elements (Left, Right : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} (Left /= No{"_"}Element and then Right /= No{"_"}Element){"\n"}                     or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>81/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Equivalent{"_"}Elements (Element (Left), Element (Right)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent{"_"}Elements (Left  : Cursor;{"\n"}                              Right : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Left /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>83/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Equivalent{"_"}Elements (Element (Left), Right).<br /></p>

<MarginText>84/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equivalent{"_"}Elements (Left  : Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                              Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Right /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>85/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Equivalent{"_"}Elements (Left, Element (Right)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>85.1/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Set){"\n"}   return Set{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>85.2/5_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting with the first element and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>For any element <i>E</i>, the actual function for the generic formal function Generic{"_"}Keys.Hash is expected to be such that Hash (<i>E</i>) = Generic{"_"}Keys.Hash (Key (<i>E</i>)). If the actuals for Key or Generic{"_"}Keys.Hash behave in some other manner, the behavior of Generic{"_"}Keys is unspecified. Which subprograms of Generic{"_"}Keys call Generic{"_"}Keys.Hash, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>87/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>For any two elements <i>E1</i> and <i>E2</i>, the boolean values Equivalent{"_"}Elements (<i>E1</i>, <i>E2</i>) and Equivalent{"_"}Keys (Key (<i>E1</i>), Key (<i>E2</i>)) are expected to be equal. If the actuals for Key or Equivalent{"_"}Keys behave in some other manner, the behavior of Generic{"_"}Keys is unspecified. Which subprograms of Generic{"_"}Keys call Equivalent{"_"}Keys, and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>88/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If <i>N</i> is the length of a set, the average time complexity of the subprograms Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find that take an element parameter should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>). The average time complexity of the subprograms that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1). The average time complexity of Reserve{"_"}Capacity should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.a/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The average time complexity of the Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets that take an element parameter should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>). The average time complexity of the subprograms of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1). The average time complexity of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets.Reserve{"_"}Capacity should be <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.b/2_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>See <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">A.18.5</a>, &ldquo;<a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">The Generic Package Containers.Hashed_Maps</a>&rdquo; for implementation notes regarding some of the operations of this package. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

The generic package Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.d/3_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Subprograms Assign and Copy are added to Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets. If an instance of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets is referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, and an entity <i>E</i> with the same <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.1#S0022">defining_identifier</a></code> as a new entity in Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets is defined in a package that is also referenced in a <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-8/AA-8.4#S0235">use_clause</a></code>, the entity <i>E</i> may no longer be use-visible, resulting in errors. This should be rare and is easily fixed if it does occur. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.e/3_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added iterator and indexing support to make hashed set containers more convenient to use. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.f/3_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added wording to require the formal function be such that equal elements are also equivalent.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.g/3_A.18.8</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Added a pragma Remote{"_"}Types so that containers can be used in distributed programs. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>88.h/5_A.18.8</MarginText>

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A number of new subprograms, types, and even a nested package were added to Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets to better support contracts and stable views. Therefore, a use clause conflict is possible; see the introduction of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/">Annex A</a> for more on this topic. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Sets now support positional container aggregates, so <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-4/AA-4.3#S0106">aggregate</a></code> syntax can be used to create Sets.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The iterator for the container now can return a parallel iterator which can be used to process the container in parallel. <br />
</Admonition>

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br />
</Admonition>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.9"></a>

## A.18.9  The Generic Package Containers.Ordered_Sets


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Ordered{"_"}Sets has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<MarginText>2/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0084-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
with Ada.Iterator{"_"}Interfaces;{"\n"}generic{"\n"}   type Element{"_"}Type is private;{"\n"}   with function "{"<"}" (Left, Right : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}   with function "=" (Left, Right : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}package Ada.Containers.Ordered{"_"}Sets{"\n"}   with Preelaborate, Remote{"_"}Types,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized is{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>2.a/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>For discussion on the reasons and meaning of the specifications of the Global and Nonblocking aspects in this generic package, see the notes on the equivalent operations in the specification of the Containers.Vectors package (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>). <br />

<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0212-1", "AI12-0339-1", "AI12-0399-1"]} />
   type Set is tagged private{"\n"}      with Constant{"_"}Indexing ={">"} Constant{"_"}Reference,{"\n"}           Default{"_"}Iterator  ={">"} Iterate,{"\n"}           Iterator{"_"}Element  ={">"} Element{"_"}Type,{"\n"}           Iterator{"_"}View     ={">"} Stable.Set,{"\n"}           Aggregate         ={">"} (Empty       ={">"} Empty,{"\n"}                                 Add{"_"}Unnamed ={">"} Include),{"\n"}           Stable{"_"}Properties ={">"} (Length,{"\n"}                                 Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited),{"\n"}           Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"}{"\n"}              Length (Set) = 0 and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Set)),{"\n"}           Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization;{"\n"}

   function Has{"_"}Element (Container : Set; Position : Cursor){"\n"}      return Boolean{"\n"}      with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

<MarginText>78/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>Two elements <i>E1</i> and <i>E2</i> are <i>equivalent</i> if both <i>E1</i> {"<"} <i>E2</i> and <i>E2</i> {"<"} <i>E1</i> return False, using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator for elements. Function Equivalent{"_"}Elements returns True if Left and Right are equivalent, and False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>79/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0044-1"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "{"<"}" on Element{"_"}Type values is expected to return the same value each time it is called with a particular pair of key values. It should define a strict weak ordering relationship (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>). If the actual for "{"<"}" behaves in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call "{"<"}" and how many times they call it, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>79.1/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0044-1"]} />
<p>If the actual function for the generic formal function "=" returns True for any pair of nonequivalent elements, then the behavior of the container function "=" is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>80/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If the value of an element stored in a set is changed other than by an operation in this package such that at least one of "{"<"}" or "=" give different results, the behavior of this package is unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>80.a/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>See <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">A.18.6</a>, &ldquo;<a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">The Generic Package Containers.Ordered_Maps</a>&rdquo; for a suggested implementation, and for justification of the restrictions regarding "{"<"}" and "=". Note that sets only need to store elements, not key/element pairs. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>81/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The <i>first element</i> of a nonempty set is the one which is less than all the other elements in the set. The <i>last element</i> of a nonempty set is the one which is greater than all the other elements in the set. The <i>successor</i> of an element is the smallest element that is larger than the given element. The <i>predecessor</i> of an element is the largest element that is smaller than the given element. All comparisons are done using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator for elements.<br /></p>

<MarginText>81.1/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Set) return Set{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}                not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>81.2/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a set whose elements are initialized from the corresponding elements of Source.<br /></p>

<MarginText>82/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete{"_"}First (Container : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (if Original{"_"}Length = 0 then Length (Container) = 0{"\n"}                    else Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length - 1));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>83/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Container is empty, Delete{"_"}First has no effect. Otherwise, the element designated by First (Container) is removed from Container. Delete{"_"}First tampers with the cursors of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>84/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete{"_"}Last (Container : in out Set){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                   Original{"_"}Length : constant Count{"_"}Type :={"\n"}                      Length (Container)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (if Original{"_"}Length = 0 then Length (Container) = 0{"\n"}                    else Length (Container) = Original{"_"}Length - 1));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>85/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Container is empty, Delete{"_"}Last has no effect. Otherwise, the element designated by Last (Container) is removed from Container. Delete{"_"}Last tampers with the cursors of Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>86/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function First{"_"}Element (Container : Set) return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>87/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Element (First (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>88/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last (Container : Set) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) then {"\n"}                    Has{"_"}Element (Container, Last'Result){"\n"}                 else Last'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>89/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a cursor that designates the last element in Container. If Container is empty, returns No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>90/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Last{"_"}Element (Container : Set) return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} (not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>91/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Element (Last (Container)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>92/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then{"\n"}                   Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>93/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals No{"_"}Element, then Previous returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, Previous returns a cursor designating the predecessor element of the one designated by Position. If Position designates the first element, then Previous returns No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>93.1/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Previous (Container : Set;{"\n"}                   Position : Cursor) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position = No{"_"}Element then{"\n"}                   Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 elsif Previous'Result = No{"_"}Element then{"\n"}                   Position = First (Container){"\n"}                 else Has{"_"}Element (Container, Previous'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>93.2/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a cursor designating the predecessor of the node designated by Position in Container, if any.<br /></p>

<MarginText>94/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />

<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />

<MarginText>95.1/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Previous (Container : in     Set;{"\n"}                    Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>95.2/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />

<MarginText>96/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Floor (Container : Set;{"\n"}                Item      : Element{"_"}Type) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Floor'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Floor'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>97/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Floor searches for the last element which is not greater than Item. If such an element is found, a cursor that designates it is returned. Otherwise, No{"_"}Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>98/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Ceiling (Container : Set;{"\n"}                  Item      : Element{"_"}Type) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Ceiling'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Ceiling'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>99/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Ceiling searches for the first element which is not less than Item. If such an element is found, a cursor that designates it is returned. Otherwise, No{"_"}Element is returned.<br /></p>

<MarginText>106/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{">"}" (Left : Cursor; Right : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Left /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}           Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>107/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Right {"<"} Element (Left).<br /></p>

<MarginText>108/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{"<"}" (Left : Element{"_"}Type; Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Right /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}           Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>109/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Left {"<"} Element (Right).<br /></p>

<MarginText>110/5_A.18.9</MarginText>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "{">"}" (Left : Element{"_"}Type; Right : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Right /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}           Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>111/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Equivalent to Element (Right) {"<"} Left.<br /></p>

<MarginText>112/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Reverse{"_"}Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Set;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>113/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterates over the elements in Container as per procedure Iterate, with the difference that the elements are traversed in predecessor order, starting with the last element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>113.1/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Set){"\n"}   return Set{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>113.2/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting with the first element and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, and starting with the last element and moving the cursor according to the predecessor relation when used as a reverse iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>113.3/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Set; Start : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Set{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Start /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Start){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>113.4/5_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns a reversible iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting with the element designated by Start and moving the cursor according to the successor relation when used as a forward iterator, or moving the cursor according to the predecessor relation when used as a reverse iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>113.a/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Exits are allowed from the loops created using the iterator objects. In particular, to stop the iteration at a particular cursor, just add <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>113.b/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
exit when Cur = Stop;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>113.c/3_A.18.9</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
in the body of the loop (assuming that Cur is the loop parameter and Stop is the cursor that you want to stop at). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>114/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>For any two elements <i>E1</i> and <i>E2</i>, the boolean values (<i>E1</i> {"<"} <i>E2</i>) and (Key(<i>E1</i>) {"<"} Key(<i>E2</i>)) are expected to be equal. If the actuals for Key or Generic{"_"}Keys."{"<"}" behave in some other manner, the behavior of this package is unspecified. Which subprograms of this package call Key and Generic{"_"}Keys."{"<"}", and how many times the functions are called, is unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>115/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>In addition to the semantics described in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.7">A.18.7</a>, the subprograms in package Generic{"_"}Keys named Floor and Ceiling, are equivalent to the corresponding subprograms in the parent package, with the difference that the Key subprogram parameter is compared to elements in the container using the Key and "{"<"}" generic formal functions. The function named Equivalent{"_"}Keys in package Generic{"_"}Keys returns True if both Left {"<"} Right and Right {"<"} Left return False using the generic formal "{"<"}" operator, and returns True otherwise.<br /></p>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>116/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>If <i>N</i> is the length of a set, then the worst-case time complexity of the Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations that take an element parameter should be <i>O</i>((log <i>N</i>){"*"}{"*"}2) or better. The worst-case time complexity of the subprograms that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>116.a/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of the Insert, Include, Replace, Delete, Exclude, and Find operations of Containers.Ordered{"_"}Sets that take an element parameter should be <i>O</i>((log <i>N</i>){"*"}{"*"}2). The worst-case time complexity of the subprograms of Containers.Ordered{"_"}Sets that take a cursor parameter should be <i>O</i>(1).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>116.b/2_A.18.9</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>See <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">A.18.6</a>, &ldquo;<a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">The Generic Package Containers.Ordered_Maps</a>&rdquo; for implementation notes regarding some of the operations of this package. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>
