<a id="Subclause_A.18.10"></a>

## A.18.10  The Generic Package Containers.Multiway_Trees

<MarginText>1/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees provides private types Tree and Cursor, and a set of operations for each type. A multiway tree container is well-suited to represent nested structures.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>1.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This tree just provides a basic structure, and make no promises about balancing or other automatic organization. In this sense, it is different than the indexed (Map, Set) forms. Rather, it provides a building block on which to construct more complex and more specialized tree containers. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>2/4_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0078-1", "AI12-0159-1"]} />
<p>A multiway tree container object manages a tree of <i>nodes</i>, consisting of a <i>root node</i> and a set of <i>internal nodes</i>; each internal node contains an element and pointers to the parent, first child, last child, next (successor) sibling, and previous (predecessor) sibling internal nodes. A cursor designates a particular node within a tree (and by extension the element contained in that node, if any). A cursor keeps designating the same node (and element) as long as the node is part of the container, even if the node is moved within the container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/4_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0078-1"]} />
<p>A <i>subtree</i> is a particular node (which <i>roots the subtree</i>) and all of its child nodes (including all of the children of the child nodes, recursively). The root node is always present and has neither an associated element value nor any parent node; it has pointers to its first child and its last child, if any. The root node provides a place to add nodes to an otherwise empty tree and represents the base of the tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>4/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>A node that has no children is called a <i>leaf node</i>. The <i>ancestors</i> of a node are the node itself, its parent node, the parent of the parent node, and so on until a node with no parent is reached. Similarly, the <i>descendants</i> of a node are the node itself, its child nodes, the children of each child node, and so on.<br /></p>

<MarginText>5/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>The nodes of a subtree can be visited in several different orders. For a <i>depth-first order</i>, after visiting a node, the nodes of its child list are each visited in depth-first order, with each child node visited in natural order (first child to last child).<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>5.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>For the depth-first order, when each child node is visited, the child list of the child node is visited before the next sibling of the child node is visited. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>6/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<MarginText>7/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
with Ada.Iterator{"_"}Interfaces;{"\n"}generic{"\n"}   type Element{"_"}Type is private;{"\n"}   with function "=" (Left, Right : Element{"_"}Type) return Boolean is {"<"}{">"};{"\n"}package Ada.Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees{"\n"}   with Preelaborate, Remote{"_"}Types,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized is{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.a/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>For discussion on the reasons and meaning of the specifications of the Global and Nonblocking aspects in this generic package, see the notes on the equivalent operations in the specification of the Containers.Vectors package (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>8/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0399-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   type Tree is tagged private{"\n"}      with Constant{"_"}Indexing ={">"} Constant{"_"}Reference,{"\n"}           Variable{"_"}Indexing ={">"} Reference,{"\n"}           Default{"_"}Iterator  ={">"} Iterate,{"\n"}           Iterator{"_"}Element  ={">"} Element{"_"}Type,{"\n"}           Iterator{"_"}View     ={">"} Stable.Tree,{"\n"}           Stable{"_"}Properties ={">"} (Node{"_"}Count,{"\n"}                                 Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited,{"\n"}                                 Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited),{"\n"}           Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"}{"\n"}              Node{"_"}Count (Tree) = 1 and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Tree)) and then{"\n"}              (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Tree)),{"\n"}           Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization;{"\n"}

   function Depth (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}      return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}      with Pre ={">"} Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Position){"\n"}                      or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}           Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

<MarginText>22.a/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>When this function is true, the Position can be meaningfully used with operations for Container. We define this because many operations allow the root (which does not have an element, so Has{"_"}Element returns False), so many preconditions get unwieldy. We allow No{"_"}Element as it is allowed by many queries, and for existing routines, it raises a different exception (Constraint{"_"}Error rather than Program{"_"}Error) than a cursor for the wrong container does. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

   package Stable is{"\n"}
<MarginText>70.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0399-1"]} />
      type Tree (Base : not null access Multiway{"_"}Trees.Tree) is{"\n"}         tagged limited private{"\n"}         with Constant{"_"}Indexing ={">"} Constant{"_"}Reference,{"\n"}              Variable{"_"}Indexing ={">"} Reference,{"\n"}              Default{"_"}Iterator  ={">"} Iterate,{"\n"}              Iterator{"_"}Element  ={">"} Element{"_"}Type,{"\n"}              Stable{"_"}Properties ={">"} (Node{"_"}Count),{"\n"}              Global            ={">"} null,{"\n"}              Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Tree) = 1,{"\n"}              Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization;{"\n"}
<MarginText>70.3/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0399-1"]} />
      type Cursor is private{"\n"}         with Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization;{"\n"}
<MarginText>70.4/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
      Empty{"_"}Tree : constant Tree;{"\n"}
<MarginText>70.5/5_A.18.10</MarginText>

      No{"_"}Element : constant Cursor;{"\n"}
<MarginText>70.6/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
      function Has{"_"}Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}         with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}
<MarginText>70.7/5_A.18.10</MarginText>

<MarginText>72/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "=" on Element{"_"}Type values is expected to define a reflexive and symmetric relationship and return the same result value each time it is called with a particular pair of values. If it behaves in some other manner, the functions Find, Reverse{"_"}Find, Equal{"_"}Subtree, and "=" on tree values return an unspecified value. The exact arguments and number of calls of this generic formal function by the functions Find, Reverse{"_"}Find, Equal{"_"}Subtree, and "=" on tree values are unspecified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>73/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>The type Tree is used to represent trees. The type Tree needs finalization (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-7/AA-7.6">7.6</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>74/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>Empty{"_"}Tree represents the empty Tree object. It contains only the root node (Node{"_"}Count (Empty{"_"}Tree) returns 1). If an object of type Tree is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as Empty{"_"}Tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>75/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>No{"_"}Element represents a cursor that designates no element. If an object of type Cursor is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>76/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0434-1"]} />
<p>The primitive "=" operator for type Cursor returns True if both cursors are No{"_"}Element, or designate the same element in the same container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>76.a/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0434-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>&ldquo;The primitive "=" operator&rdquo; is the one with two parameters of type Cursor which returns Boolean. We're not talking about some other (hidden) primitive function named "=". <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>77/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Execution of the default implementation of the Input, Output, Read, or Write attribute of type Cursor raises Program{"_"}Error.<br /></p>

<MarginText>78/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0437-1"]} />
<p>Tree'Write for a Tree object <i>T</i> writes Node{"_"}Count(<i>T</i>) - 1 elements of the tree to the stream. It may also write additional information about the tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>79/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>Tree'Read reads the representation of a tree from the stream, and assigns to <i>Item</i> a tree with the same elements and structure as was written by Tree'Write.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>79.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Streaming more elements than the container holds is wrong. For implementation implications of this rule, see the Implementation Note in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>80/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>[Some operations check for &ldquo;tampering with cursors&rdquo; of a container because they depend on the set of elements of the container remaining constant, and others check for &ldquo;tampering with elements&rdquo; of a container because they depend on elements of the container not being replaced.] When tampering with cursors is <i>prohibited</i> for a particular tree object <i>T</i>, Program{"_"}Error is propagated by the finalization of <i>T</i>[, as well as by a call that passes <i>T</i> to certain of the operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation]. Similarly, when tampering with elements is <i>prohibited</i> for <i>T</i>, Program{"_"}Error is propagated by a call that passes <i>T</i> to certain of the other operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation.<br /></p>

<p><i>Paragraphs 81 through 90 are removed as preconditions now describe these rules.</i> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>85.a.1/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>We don't need to explicitly mention <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>, because that finalizes the target object as part of the operation, and finalization of an object is already defined as tampering with cursors. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>91/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has{"_"}Element (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>92/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Position designates an element, and returns False otherwise. [In particular, Has{"_"}Element returns False if the cursor designates a root node or equals No{"_"}Element.]<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>92.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1", "AI05-0136-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>This function might not detect cursors that designate deleted elements; such cursors are invalid (see below) and the result of calling Has{"_"}Element with an invalid cursor is unspecified (but not erroneous). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>92.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Has{"_"}Element (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>92.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Position designates an element in Container, and returns False otherwise. [In particular, Has{"_"}Element returns False if the cursor designates a root node or equals No{"_"}Element.]<br /></p>

<MarginText>93/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Equal{"_"}Subtree (Left{"_"}Position : Cursor;{"\n"}                        Right{"_"}Position: Cursor) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>94/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Left{"_"}Position or Right{"_"}Position equals No{"_"}Element, propagates Constraint{"_"}Error. If the number of child nodes of the element designated by Left{"_"}Position is different from the number of child nodes of the element designated by Right{"_"}Position, the function returns False. If Left{"_"}Position designates a root node and Right{"_"}Position does not, the function returns False. If Right{"_"}Position designates a root node and Left{"_"}Position does not, the function returns False. Unless both cursors designate a root node, the elements are compared using the generic formal equality operator. If the result of the element comparison is False, the function returns False. Otherwise, it calls Equal{"_"}Subtree on a cursor designating each child element of the element designated by Left{"_"}Position and a cursor designating the corresponding child element of the element designated by Right{"_"}Position. If any such call returns False, the function returns False; otherwise, it returns True. Any exception raised during the evaluation of element equality is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>94.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Left{"_"}Position and Right{"_"}Position do not need to be from the same tree. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>94.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality function is unspecified for all of the operations that use it in this package, so an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Similarly, a global rule (see the introduction of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/">Annex A</a>) says that language-defined routines are not affected by overriding of other language-defined routines. This means that no reasonable program can tell how many times Equal{"_"}Subtree is called, and thus an implementation can call it as many or as few times as it needs to get the correct answer. Specifically, there is no requirement to call the formal equality or Equal{"_"}Subtree additional times once the answer has been determined. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>95/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : Tree) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Left and Right denote the same tree object, then the function returns True. Otherwise, it calls Equal{"_"}Subtree with cursors designating the root nodes of Left and Right; the result is returned. Any exception raised during the evaluation of Equal{"_"}Subtree is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Similar considerations apply here as apply to Equal{"_"}Subtree. The actual number of calls performed is unspecified. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with cursors or tampering with elements is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.b/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Prohibiting tampering with elements also needs to prohibit tampering with cursors, as deleting an element is similar to replacing it. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.c/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Various contracts elsewhere in this specification require that this function be implemented with synchronized data. Moreover, it is possible for tampering to be prohibited by multiple operations (sequentially or in parallel). Therefore, tampering needs to be implemented with an atomic or protected counter. The counter is initialized to zero, and is incremented when tampering is prohibited, and decremented when leaving an area that prohibited tampering. Function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited returns True if the counter is nonzero. (Note that any case where the result is not well-defined for one task is incorrect use of shared variables and would be erroneous by the rules of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-9/AA-9.10">9.10</a>, so no special protection is needed to read the counter.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.3/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited{"\n"}   (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.4/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Always returns False[, regardless of whether tampering with elements is prohibited].<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.d/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>A definite element cannot change size, so we allow operations that tamper with elements even when tampering with elements is prohibited. That's not true for the indefinite containers, which is why this kind of tampering exists. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>96.5/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Empty (Container : Tree) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is{"_"}Empty'Result = (Node{"_"}Count (Container) = 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>96.6/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Container is empty.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>96.e/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>An empty tree contains just the root node. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>97/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Node{"_"}Count (Container : Tree) return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>98/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Node{"_"}Count returns the number of nodes in Container.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>98.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Since all tree objects have a root node, this can never return a value of 0. Node{"_"}Count (Some{"_"}Tree) should always equal Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Root (Some{"_"}Tree)). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>99/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Position : Cursor) return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>100/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position is No{"_"}Element, Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count returns 0; otherwise, Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count returns the number of nodes in the subtree that is rooted by Position.<br /></p>

<MarginText>101/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>102/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position is No{"_"}Element, Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count returns 0; otherwise, Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count returns the number of nodes in the subtree of Container that is rooted by Position.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>102.a/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>102.b/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We raise Program{"_"}Error if Position belongs to some other container because we have promised to read only the container passed to this function. Determining the answer requires reading the container that Position belongs to, which we've promised not to do if it is not Container. We don't make this check for functions like Has{"_"}Element and Is{"_"}Root which do not require reading another container to determine the answer, but we do make it for most functions. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>103/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Depth (Position : Cursor) return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>104/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals No{"_"}Element, Depth returns 0; otherwise, Depth returns the number of ancestor nodes of the node designated by Position (including the node itself).<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>104.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Depth (Root (Some{"_"}Tree)) = 1. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>104.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Depth (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Position) {"\n"}                  or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>104.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Position equals No{"_"}Element, Depth returns 0; otherwise, Depth returns the number of ancestor nodes of the node of Container designated by Position (including the node itself).<br /></p>

<MarginText>105/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Root (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>106/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Is{"_"}Root returns True if the Position designates the root node of some tree; and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>106.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Root (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>106.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Is{"_"}Root returns True if the Position designates the root node of Container; and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>106.a/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The two parameter Is{"_"}Root returns False even if Position is the root of some other tree than Container. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>107/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Leaf (Position : Cursor) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>108/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Is{"_"}Leaf returns True if Position designates a node that does not have any child nodes; and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>108.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Is{"_"}Leaf returns False if passed No{"_"}Element, since No{"_"}Element does not designate a node. Is{"_"}Leaf can be passed a cursor that designates the root node; Is{"_"}Leaf will return True if passed the root node of an empty tree. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>108.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Leaf (Container : Tree; Position : Cursor){"\n"}   return Boolean{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Position) {"\n"}                  or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

<MarginText>109/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Root (Container : Tree) return Cursor{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Root'Result /= No{"_"}Element and then{"\n"}                not Has{"_"}Element (Container, Root'Result);{"\n"}

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>110.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>

</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>111/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Tree){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Container) = 1;{"\n"}

<MarginText>112/3_A.18.10</MarginText>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>112.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>

<MarginText>113/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginText>115/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace{"_"}Element (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                           Position  : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                           New{"_"}item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

<MarginText>116/5_A.18.10</MarginText>

<p class="Indented4">Replace{"_"}Element assigns the value New{"_"}Item to the element designated by Position. For the purposes of determining whether the parameters overlap in a call to Replace{"_"}Element, the Container parameter is not considered to overlap with any object [(including itself)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>117/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query{"_"}Element{"\n"}  (Position : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process  : not null access procedure (Element : in Element{"_"}Type)){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}     Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

<MarginText>118/5_A.18.10</MarginText>

<MarginText>119/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginText>120/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Update{"_"}Element calls Process.<b>all</b> with the element designated by Position as the argument. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>121/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">If Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained and definite, then the actual Element parameter of Process.<b>all</b> shall be unconstrained.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>121.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>This means that the elements cannot be directly allocated from the heap; it must be possible to change the discriminants of the element in place. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>122/5_A.18.10</MarginText>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}      (Element : not null access constant Element{"_"}Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit{"_"}Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} (raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}
<MarginText>123/5_A.18.10</MarginText>

type Reference{"_"}Type (Element : not null access Element{"_"}Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit{"_"}Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} (raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

<MarginText>124/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">The types Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type and Reference{"_"}Type need finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>125/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>125.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>It is expected that Reference{"_"}Type (and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type) will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>126/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant{"_"}Reference (Container : aliased in Tree;{"\n"}                             Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

<MarginText>127/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Constant{"_"}Indexing and Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read access to an individual element of a tree given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>128/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Constant{"_"}Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant{"_"}Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>129/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference (Container : aliased in out Tree;{"\n"}                    Position  : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position) {"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post   ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

<MarginText>130/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Variable{"_"}Indexing and Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to an individual element of a tree given a cursor.<br /></p>

<MarginText>131/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the element designated by Position. Tampering with the elements of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>132/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Tree; Source : in Tree){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Source) = Node{"_"}Count (Target);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>133/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the elements of Source are copied to Target as for an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> assigning Source to Target.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>133.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Each element in Target has a parent element that corresponds to the parent element of the Source element, and has child elements that correspond to the child elements of the Source element. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>133.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This routine exists for compatibility with the bounded tree container. For an unbounded tree, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave identically. For a bounded tree, := will raise an exception if the container capacities are different, while Assign will not raise an exception if there is enough room in the target. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>134/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Tree) return Tree{"\n"}   with Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Node{"_"}Count (Copy'Result) = Node{"_"}Count (Source) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}           not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>135/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a tree with the same structure as Source and whose elements are initialized from the corresponding elements of Source.<br /></p>

<MarginText>136/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Tree;{"\n"}                Source : in out Tree){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}               Node{"_"}Count (Target) = Node{"_"}Count (Source'Old) and then{"\n"}               Node{"_"}Count (Source) = 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>137/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, Move first calls Clear (Target). Then, the nodes other than the root node in Source are moved to Target (in the same positions). After Move completes, Node{"_"}Count (Target) is the number of nodes originally in Source, and Node{"_"}Count (Source) is 1.<br /></p>

<MarginText>138/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete{"_"}Leaf (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                       Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Is{"_"}Leaf (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"}{"\n"}           Node{"_"}Count (Container)'Old = Node{"_"}Count (Container) + 1 and then{"\n"}           Position = No{"_"}Element;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>139/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Delete{"_"}Leaf removes (from Container) the element designated by Position, and Position is set to No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>139.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The check on Position checks that the cursor does not belong to some other Container. This check implies that a reference to the container is included in the cursor value. This wording is not meant to require detection of dangling cursors; such cursors are defined to be invalid, which means that execution is erroneous, and any result is allowed (including not raising an exception).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>139.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The root node cannot be deleted. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>140/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete{"_"}Subtree (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Position  : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Container)'Old = Node{"_"}Count (Container) +{"\n"}                   Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Container, Position)'Old and then{"\n"}                Position = No{"_"}Element;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>141/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Delete{"_"}Subtree removes (from Container) the subtree designated by Position (that is, all descendants of the node designated by Position including the node itself), and Position is set to No{"_"}Element.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>141.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The root node cannot be deleted. To delete the entire contents of the tree, call Clear(Container). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>142/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                I, J      : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (I /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (J /= No{"_"}Element or else Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, I){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, J){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>143/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Swap exchanges the values of the elements designated by I and J.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>143.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>After a call to Swap, I designates the element value previously designated by J, and J designates the element value previously designated by I. The position of the elements do not change; for instance, the parent node and the first child node of I are unchanged by the operation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>143.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The root nodes do not contain element values, so they cannot be swapped. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>143.c/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>To be honest: </b>The implementation is not required to actually copy the elements if it can do the swap some other way. But it is allowed to copy the elements if needed. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>144/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find (Container : Tree;{"\n"}               Item      : Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (if Find'Result /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>145/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Find searches the elements of Container for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the root node. The search traverses the tree in a depth-first order. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>146/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree (Position : Cursor;{"\n"}                          Item     : Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree'Result)),{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree searches the subtree rooted by Position for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the element designated by Position. The search traverses the subtree in a depth-first order. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>147.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree does not check any siblings of the element designated by Position. The root node does not contain an element, and therefore it can never be returned, but it can be explicitly passed to Position. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>147.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree (Container : Tree;{"\n"}                          Position  : Cursor;{"\n"}                          Item      : Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>147.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Find{"_"}In{"_"}Subtree searches the subtree of Container rooted by Position for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the element designated by Position. The search traverses the subtree in a depth-first order. If no equal element is found, then Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>148/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Ancestor{"_"}Find (Position : Cursor;{"\n"}                        Item     : Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} Position /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Ancestor{"_"}Find'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Ancestor{"_"}Find'Result)),{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>149/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Ancestor{"_"}Find searches for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the node designated by Position, and checks each ancestor proceeding toward the root of the subtree. If no equal element is found, then Ancestor{"_"}Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>149.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0248-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>No{"_"}Element is returned if Position is the root node. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>149.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Ancestor{"_"}Find (Container : Tree;{"\n"}                        Position  : Cursor;{"\n"}                        Item      : Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   return Cursor{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if Ancestor{"_"}Find'Result = No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                 then Has{"_"}Element (Container, Ancestor{"_"}Find'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>149.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Ancestor{"_"}Find searches for an element equal to Item (using the generic formal equality operator). The search starts at the node designated by Position in Container, and checks each ancestor proceeding toward the root of the subtree. If no equal element is found, then Ancestor{"_"}Find returns No{"_"}Element. Otherwise, it returns a cursor designating the first equal element encountered.<br /></p>

<MarginText>152/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"\n"}  (Container : in Tree;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>153/4_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0069-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate calls Process.<b>all</b> with a cursor that designates each element in Container, starting from the root node and proceeding in a depth-first order. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>153.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Process is not called with the root node, which does not have an associated element. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>153.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The purpose of the tamper with cursors check is to prevent erroneous execution from the Position parameter of Process.<b>all</b> becoming invalid. This check takes place when the operations that tamper with the cursors of the container are called. The check cannot be made later (say in the body of Iterate), because that could cause the Position cursor to be invalid and potentially cause execution to become erroneous &mdash; defeating the purpose of the check.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>153.c/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
See Iterate for vectors (<a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>) for a suggested implementation of the check. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>154/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"_"}Subtree{"\n"}  (Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} Position /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>155/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0069-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate{"_"}Subtree calls Process.<b>all</b> with a cursor that designates each element in the subtree rooted by the node designated by Position, starting from the node designated by Position and proceeding in a depth-first order. Tampering with the cursors of the tree that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>155.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Position can be passed a cursor designating the root node; in that case, Process is not called with the root node, which does not have an associated element. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>155.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Iterate{"_"}Subtree{"\n"}  (Container : in Tree;{"\n"}   Position  : in Cursor;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Position : in Cursor)){"\n"}   with Allows{"_"}Exit,{"\n"}        Pre  ={">"} (Position /= No{"_"}Element {"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>155.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate{"_"}Subtree calls Process.<b>all</b> with a cursor that designates each element in the subtree rooted by the node designated by Position in Container, starting from the node designated by Position and proceeding in a depth-first order. Tampering with the cursors of the tree that contains the element designated by Position is prohibited during the execution of a call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<MarginText>156/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate (Container : in Tree){"\n"}   return Tree{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>157/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0069-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in Container, starting from the root node and proceeding in a depth-first order when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Exits are allowed from the loops created using the iterator objects. In particular, to stop the iteration at a particular cursor, just add <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
exit when Cur = Stop;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>157.c/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
in the body of the loop (assuming that Cur is the loop parameter and Stop is the cursor that you want to stop at). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>158/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate{"_"}Subtree (Position : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Tree{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre    ={">"} Position /= No{"_"}Element or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>159/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0069-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate{"_"}Subtree returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each element in the subtree rooted by the node designated by Position, starting from the node designated by Position and proceeding in a depth-first order when used as a forward iterator, and processing all nodes in the subtree concurrently when used as a parallel iterator. Tampering with the cursors of the container that contains the node designated by Position is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). <CodeBlock language="ada">

<MarginText>162/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Child{"_"}Depth (Parent, Child : Cursor) return Count{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Parent /= No{"_"}Element and then Child /= No{"_"}Element){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}     Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in all, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>163/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Child{"_"}Depth returns the number of ancestor nodes of Child (including Child itself), up to but not including Parent; Program{"_"}Error is propagated if Parent is not an ancestor of Child.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>163.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>Program{"_"}Error is propagated if Parent and Child are nodes in different containers.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>163.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Child{"_"}Depth (Root (Some{"_"}Tree), Child) + 1 = Depth (Child) as the root is not counted. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>164/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert{"_"}Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Container) ={"\n"}                Node{"_"}Count (Container)'Old + Count;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>165/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert{"_"}Child allocates Count nodes containing copies of New{"_"}Item and inserts them as children of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>166/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert{"_"}Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                        Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node{"_"}Count (Container) ={"\n"}                 Node{"_"}Count (Container)'Old + Count) and then{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>167/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0257-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert{"_"}Child allocates Count nodes containing copies of New{"_"}Item and inserts them as children of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. Position designates the first newly-inserted node, or if Count equals 0, then Position is assigned the value of Before. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>168/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert{"_"}Child (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                        Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node{"_"}Count (Container) ={"\n"}                 Node{"_"}Count (Container)'Old + Count) and then{"\n"}                 Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>169/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0257-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0264-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Insert{"_"}Child allocates Count nodes, the elements contained in the new nodes are initialized by default (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>), and the new nodes are inserted as children of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. Position designates the first newly-inserted node, or if Count equals 0, then Position is assigned the value of Before. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

</CodeBlock>

<MarginText>174/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Delete{"_"}Children (Container : in out Tree;{"\n"}                           Parent    : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node{"_"}Count (Container) = Node{"_"}Count (Container)'Old -{"\n"}                   Child{"_"}Count (Container, Parent)'Old) and then{"\n"}                 Child{"_"}Count (Container, Parent) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>175/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Delete{"_"}Children removes (from Container) all of the descendants of Parent other than Parent itself.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>175.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This routine deletes all of the child subtrees of Parent at once. Use Delete{"_"}Subtree to delete an individual subtree. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>176/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Copy{"_"}Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Source   : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                    Target.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (not Is{"_"}Root (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Target) ={"\n"}                Node{"_"}Count (Target)'Old + Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Source),{"\n"}        Global ={">"} in all;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>177/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Source is equal to No{"_"}Element, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the subtree rooted by Source (which can be from any tree; it does not have to be a subtree of Target) is copied (new nodes are allocated to create a new subtree with the same structure as the Source subtree, with each element initialized from the corresponding element of the Source subtree) and inserted into Target as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. The parent of the newly created subtree is set to Parent, and the overall count of Target is incremented by Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Source). Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>177.a/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>We only need one routine here, as the source object is not modified, so we can use the same routine for both copying within and between containers. However, that requires a contract that allows reading of any container of the correct type, so we provide two other routines wuth more restrictive contracts. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>177.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>We do not allow copying a subtree that includes a root node, as that would require inserting a node with no value in the middle of the target tree. To copy an entire tree to another tree object, use Copy. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>177.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Copy{"_"}Local{"_"}Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                              Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                              Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                              Source   : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                    Target.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (not Is{"_"}Root (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Target) = Node{"_"}Count (Target)'Old +{"\n"}                   Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Target, Source);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>177.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Source is equal to No{"_"}Element, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the subtree rooted by Source in Target is copied (new nodes are allocated to create a new subtree with the same structure as the Source subtree, with each element initialized from the corresponding element of the Source subtree) and inserted into Target as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. The parent of the newly created subtree is set to Parent. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>177.3/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Copy{"_"}Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                        Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                        Source   : in     Tree;{"\n"}                        Subtree  : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                    Target.Parent (Before) = Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (Meaningful{"_"}For (Source, Subtree){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                 (not Is{"_"}Root (Source, Subtree){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Node{"_"}Count (Target) = Node{"_"}Count (Target)'Old +{"\n"}                   Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Source, Subtree);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>177.4/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Subtree is equal to No{"_"}Element, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the subtree rooted by Subtree in Source is copied (new nodes are allocated to create a new subtree with the same structure as the Subtree, with each element initialized from the corresponding element of the Subtree) and inserted into Target as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the new nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the new nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. The parent of the newly created subtree is set to Parent. Any exception raised during allocation of internal storage is propagated, and Container is not modified.<br /></p>

<MarginText>178/5_A.18.10</MarginText>

procedure Splice{"_"}Subtree (Target   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Source   : in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Position : in out Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Target, Before){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Target.Parent (Before) /= Parent{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Source, Position){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) or else{"\n"}                 Position = Before or else{"\n"}                 Is{"_"}Ancestor{"_"}Of (Target, Position, Parent){"\n"}                    or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (declare{"\n"}                    Org{"_"}Sub{"_"}Count renames{"\n"}                        Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Source, Position)'Old;{"\n"}                    Org{"_"}Target{"_"}Count renames Node{"_"}Count (Target)'Old;{"\n"}                 begin{"\n"}                   (if not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                       Node{"_"}Count (Target) = Org{"_"}Target{"_"}Count +{"\n"}                          Org{"_"}Sub{"_"}Count and then{"\n"}                       Node{"_"}Count (Source) = Node{"_"}Count (Source)'Old -{"\n"}                          Org{"_"}Sub{"_"}Count and then{"\n"}                       Has{"_"}Element (Target, Position){"\n"}                    else{"\n"}                       Target.Parent (Position) = Parent and then{"\n"}                       Node{"_"}Count (Target) = Org{"_"}Target{"_"}Count));{"\n"}

<MarginText>179/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Source denotes the same object as Target, then: if Position equals Before there is no effect; otherwise, the subtree rooted by the element designated by Position is moved to be a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the moved nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the moved nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. In each of these cases, Position and the count of Target are unchanged, and the parent of the element designated by Position is set to Parent.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>179.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We can't allow moving the subtree of Position to a proper descendant node of the subtree, as the descendant node will be part of the subtree being moved. The result would be a circularly linked tree, or one with inaccessible nodes. Thus we have to check Position against Parent, even though such a check is <i>O</i>(Depth(Source)). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>180/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Otherwise (if Source does not denote the same object as Target), the subtree designated by Position is removed from Source and moved to Target. The subtree is inserted as a child of Parent. If Parent already has child nodes, then the moved nodes are inserted prior to the node designated by Before, or, if Before equals No{"_"}Element, the moved nodes are inserted after the last existing child node of Parent. In each of these cases, the count of Target is incremented by Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Position), and the count of Source is decremented by Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Position), Position is updated to represent an element in Target.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>180.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>If Source is the same as Target, and Position = Before, or Next{"_"}Sibling(Position) = Before, Splice{"_"}Subtree has no effect, as the subtree does not have to move to meet the postcondition.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>180.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
We do not allow splicing a subtree that includes a root node, as that would require inserting a node with no value in the middle of the target tree. Splice the children of the root node instead.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>180.c/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
For this reason there is no operation to splice an entire tree, as that would necessarily involve splicing a root node. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>
