procedure Splice{"_"}Subtree (Container: in out Tree;{"\n"}                          Parent   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Before   : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                          Position : in     Cursor){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Before){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Before = No{"_"}Element or else{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Before) /= Parent{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Has{"_"}Element (Container, Position){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Position = Before or else{"\n"}                 Is{"_"}Ancestor{"_"}Of (Container, Position, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (Node{"_"}Count (Container) ={"\n"}                   Node{"_"}Count (Container)'Old and then{"\n"}                 Container.Parent (Position) = Parent);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>

The parent of the element designated by Position is set to Parent.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>182.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">

<li>if Target{"_"}Parent equals Source{"_"}Parent there is no effect; else<br /></li>

<MarginText>189/3_A.18.10</MarginText>

<p class="Indented4">Otherwise (if Source does not denote the same object as Target), the child elements (and the further descendants) of Source{"_"}Parent are removed from Source and moved to Target. In each of these cases, the overall count of Target is incremented by Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Source{"_"}Parent)-1, and the overall count of Source is decremented by Subtree{"_"}Node{"_"}Count (Source{"_"}Parent)-1.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>218/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Iterate{"_"}Children (Container : in Tree; Parent : in Cursor){"\n"}   return Tree{"_"}Iterator{"_"}Interfaces.Parallel{"_"}Reversible{"_"}Iterator'Class{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (Parent /= No{"_"}Element{"\n"}                   or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (Meaningful{"_"}For (Container, Parent){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>219/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0266-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Iterate{"_"}Children returns an iterator object (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.1">5.5.1</a>) that will generate a value for a loop parameter (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#Subclause_5.5.2">5.5.2</a>) designating each child node of Parent. When used as a forward iterator, the nodes are designated starting with the first child node and moving the cursor as per the function Next{"_"}Sibling; when used as a reverse iterator, the nodes are designated starting with the last child node and moving the cursor as per the function Previous{"_"}Sibling; when used as a parallel iterator, processing all child nodes concurrently. Tampering with the cursors of Container is prohibited while the iterator object exists (in particular, in the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.1#S0166">sequence_of_statements</a></code> of the <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0178">loop_statement</a></code> whose <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.5#S0183">iterator_specification</a></code> denotes this object). The iterator object needs finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>219.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The nested package Multiway{"_"}Trees.Stable provides a type Stable.Tree that represents a <i>stable</i> tree, which is one that cannot grow and shrink. Such a tree can be created by calling the Copy function, or by establishing a <i>stabilized view</i> of an ordinary tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>219.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The subprograms of package Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees that have a parameter or result of type tree are included in the nested package Stable with the same specification, except that the following are omitted:<br /></p>

<MarginText>219.3/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<p class="Indented2">Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited, Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited, Assign, Move, Clear, Delete{"_"}Leaf, Insert{"_"}Child, Delete{"_"}Children, Delete{"_"}Subtree, Copy{"_"}Subtree, Copy{"_"}Local{"_"}Subtree, Splice{"_"}Subtree, and Splice{"_"}Children <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>219.a.1/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The names Tree and Cursor mean the types declared in the nested package in these subprogram specifications. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>219.a.2/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>The omitted routines are those that tamper with cursors or elements (or test that state). The model is that it is impossible to tamper with cursors or elements of a stable view since no such operations are included. Thus tampering checks are not needed for a stable view, and we omit the operations associated with those checks. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>219.4/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<p>The operations of this package are equivalent to those for ordinary trees, except that the calls to Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited and Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited that occur in preconditions are replaced by False, and any that occur in postconditions are replaced by True.<br /></p>

<MarginText>219.5/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0439-1"]} />
<p>If a stable tree is declared with the Base discriminant designating a pre-existing ordinary tree, the stable tree represents a stabilized view of the underlying ordinary tree, and any operation on the stable tree is reflected on the underlying ordinary tree. While a stabilized view exists, any operation that tampers with elements performed on the underlying tree is prohibited. The finalization of a stable tree that provides such a view removes this restriction on the underlying ordinary tree [(though some other restriction can exist due to other concurrent iterations or stabilized views)].<br /></p>

<MarginText>219.6/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0438-1"]} />
<p>If a stable tree is declared without specifying Base, the object is necessarily initialized. The initializing expression of the stable tree, [typically a call on Copy], determines the Node{"_"}Count of the tree. The Node{"_"}Count of a stable tree never changes after initialization.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>219.a/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0438-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Initialization is required as the type is indefinite, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-3/AA-3.3#Subclause_3.3.1">3.3.1</a>. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>220/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error for the actual function associated with a generic formal subprogram, when called as part of an operation of this package, to tamper with elements of any Tree parameter of the operation. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised, or the operation works as defined on the value of the Tree either prior to, or subsequent to, some or all of the modifications to the Tree.<br /></p>

<MarginText>221/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram declared in the visible part of Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees when the associated container has been finalized. If the operation takes Container as an <b>in out</b> parameter, then it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. Otherwise, the operation either proceeds as it would for an empty container, or it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. <br /></p>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>222/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>A Cursor value is <i>invalid</i> if any of the following have occurred since it was created: <br /></p>

<MarginText>223/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The tree that contains the element it designates has been finalized;<br /></li>
<MarginText>224/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<li>The tree that contains the element it designates has been used as the Source or Target of a call to Move;<br /></li>
<MarginText>225/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<li>The tree that contains the element it designates has been used as the Target of a call to Assign or the target of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code>;<br /></li>
<MarginText>226/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<li>The element it designates has been removed from the tree that previously contained the element. <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>226.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We talk about which tree the element was removed from in order to handle splicing nodes from one tree to another. The node still exists, but any cursors that designate it in the original tree are now invalid. This bullet covers removals caused by calls to Clear, Delete{"_"}Leaf, Delete{"_"}Subtree, Delete{"_"}Children, Splice{"_"}Children, and Splice{"_"}Subtree. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>227/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<p>The result of "=" or Has{"_"}Element is unspecified if it is called with an invalid cursor parameter. Execution is erroneous if any other subprogram declared in Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees is called with an invalid cursor parameter.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>227.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>The list above is intended to be exhaustive. In other cases, a cursor value continues to designate its original element (or the root node). For instance, cursor values survive the insertion and deletion of other nodes.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>227.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
While it is possible to check for these cases, in many cases the overhead necessary to make the check is substantial in time or space. Implementations are encouraged to check for as many of these cases as possible and raise Program{"_"}Error if detected. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>228/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p>Execution is erroneous if the tree associated with the result of a call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized before the result object returned by the call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>228.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Each object of Reference{"_"}Type and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type probably contains some reference to the originating container. If that container is prematurely finalized (which is only possible via Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation, as accessibility checks prevent passing a container to Reference that will not live as long as the result), the finalization of the object of Reference{"_"}Type will try to access a nonexistent object. This is a normal case of a dangling pointer created by Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation; we have to explicitly mention it here as the pointer in question is not visible in the specification of the type. (This is the same reason we have to say this for invalid cursors.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>229/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>No storage associated with a multiway tree object shall be lost upon assignment or scope exit.<br /></p>

<MarginText>230/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>The execution of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> for a tree shall have the effect of copying the elements from the source tree object to the target tree object and changing the node count of the target object to that of the source object.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>230.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0298-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>An assignment of a Tree is a &ldquo;deep&rdquo; copy; that is the elements are copied as well the data structures. We say &ldquo;effect of&rdquo; in order to allow the implementation to avoid copying elements immediately if it wishes. For instance, an implementation that avoided copying until one of the containers is modified would be allowed. (Note that this implementation would require care, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>231/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees should be implemented similarly to a multiway tree. In particular, if <i>N</i> is the overall number of nodes for a particular tree, then the worst-case time complexity of Element, Parent, First{"_"}Child, Last{"_"}Child, Next{"_"}Sibling, Previous{"_"}Sibling, Insert{"_"}Child with Count=1, and Delete should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>). <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>231.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The worst-case time complexity of the Element, Parent, First{"_"}Child, Last{"_"}Child, Next{"_"}Sibling, Previous{"_"}Sibling, Insert{"_"}Child with Count=1, and Delete operations of Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees should be <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>231.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>We do not mean to overly constrain implementation strategies here. However, it is important for portability that the performance of large containers has roughly the same factors on different implementations. If a program is moved to an implementation that takes <i>O</i>(<i>N</i>) time to access elements, that program could be unusable when the trees are large. We allow <i>O</i>(log <i>N</i>) access because the proportionality constant and caching effects are likely to be larger than the log factor, and we don't want to discourage innovative implementations. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>232/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>232.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees.Move should not copy elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>232.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Usually that can be accomplished simply by moving the pointer(s) to the internal data structures from the Source container to the Target container. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>233/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1"]} />
<p>If an exception is propagated from a tree operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a tree unless specified by the operation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.a/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>If an exception is propagated from a tree operation, no storage should be lost, nor any elements removed from a tree unless specified by the operation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.b/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is important so that programs can recover from errors. But we don't want to require heroic efforts, so we just require documentation of cases where this can't be accomplished. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.c/3_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0136-1", "AI05-0257-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The generic package Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.d/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Tampering with elements is now defined to be equivalent to tampering with cursors for ordinary containers. If a program requires tampering detection to work, it might fail in Ada 2022. Needless to say, this shouldn't happen outside of test programs. See Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more details. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.e/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A number of new subprograms, types, and even a nested package were added to Containers.Multiway{"_"}Trees to better support contracts and stable views. Therefore, a use clause conflict is possible; see the introduction of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/">Annex A</a> for more on this topic. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.f/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0196-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Replace{"_"}Element is now defined such that it can be used concurrently so long as it operates on different elements. This allows some container operations to be used in parallel without separate synchronization.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.g/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0266-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Most iterators can now return parallel iterators, to be used in parallel constructs. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.h/4_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0069-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Fixed the function Iterate so it is clear that the root node is never visited.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.i/4_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0078-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> The definition of <i>node</i> is clarified so that it it doesn't appear to say all nodes have an element.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.j/4_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0110-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Clarified that tampering checks precede all other checks made by a subprogram (but come after those associated with the call).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>233.k/5_A.18.10</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.11"></a>

## A.18.11  The Generic Package Containers.Indefinite_Vectors

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Vectors provides a private type Vector and a set of operations. It provides the same operations as the package Containers.Vectors (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>), with the difference that the generic formal Element{"_"}Type is indefinite. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0092-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Vectors has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Vectors except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The generic formal Element{"_"}Type is indefinite.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<li>The procedures with the profiles: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Extended{"_"}Index;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1);{"\n"}
<MarginText>6/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
procedure Insert (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>are omitted.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.a/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>These procedures are omitted because there is no way to create a default-initialized object of an indefinite type. Note that Insert{"_"}Space can be used instead of this routine in most cases. Omitting the routine completely allows any problems to be diagnosed by the compiler when converting from a definite to indefinite vector. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>8/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The actual Element parameter of access subprogram Process of Update{"_"}Element may be constrained even if Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained.<br /></li>
<MarginText>9/4_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<li>The operations "&", Append, Insert, Prepend, Replace{"_"}Element, and To{"_"}Vector that have a formal parameter of type Element{"_"}Type perform indefinite insertion (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>).<br /></li>
<MarginText>10/5_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<li>The description of Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>11/5_A.18.11</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with elements is prohibited for Container, and False otherwise. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>11.a/5_A.18.11</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Complete replacement of an element can cause its memory to be deallocated while another operation is holding onto a reference to it. That can't be allowed. However, a simple modification of (part of) an element is not a problem, so Update{"_"}Element does not cause a problem. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>12/5_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited in the postcondition for the operations Reference and Constant{"_"}Reference.<br /></li>
<MarginText>13/5_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<li>The operations Replace{"_"}Element, Reverse{"_"}Elements, and Swap, and the nested generic unit Generic{"_"}Sorting are omitted from the nested package Stable.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>13.a/2_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Vectors is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>13.b/4_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Defined some routines to &ldquo;perform indefinite insertion&rdquo;. This could mean that some calls to those routines would now raise Program{"_"}Error where they previously worked. However, this is extremely unlikely, as it would require that the package was not implemented in Ada (an Ada <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-4/AA-4.8#S0164">allocator</a></code> would raise Program{"_"}Error in these circumstances), and that a program inserted a more nested tagged type (or access discriminant) into a container, and then used that object before its type or discriminant went out of scope. All known implementations are implemented in Ada, so we believe there is no practical incompatibility. As such, we mention this only for completeness.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>13.c/5_A.18.11</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Defined the Iterator{"_"}View aspect, so that the stable view is used for container element iterators. This means that tampering with elements is prohibited during the entire loop, rather than tampering with cursors being prohibited during the loop, and tampering with elements being prohibited only during the lifetimes of references to the loop parameter. Thus, if a container element iterator does an operation that tampers with elements on the iterated container, that operation will fail a tampering check in Ada 2022 (and thus raise Program{"_"}Error), while it would have worked in Ada 2012 so long as the loop parameter is not involved. We believe this to be a dubious loop structure that should be rare. Note that this issue only occurs for the indefinite container form, the ordinary and bounded containers allow such operations at any time in Ada 2022.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.12"></a>

## A.18.12  The Generic Package Containers.Indefinite_Doubly_Linked_Lists

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists provides private types List and Cursor, and a set of operations for each type. It provides the same operations as the package Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.3">A.18.3</a>), with the difference that the generic formal Element{"_"}Type is indefinite. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0092-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The generic formal Element{"_"}Type is indefinite.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<li>The procedure with the profile: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out List;{"\n"}                  Before    : in     Cursor;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Count     : in     Count{"_"}Type := 1);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>6/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>is omitted.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>6.a/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This procedure is omitted because there is no way to create a default-initialized object of an indefinite type. We considered having this routine insert an empty element similar to the empty elements of a vector, but rejected this possibility because the semantics are fairly complex and very different from the existing definite container. That would make it more error-prone to convert a container from a definite type to an indefinite type; by omitting the routine completely, any problems will be diagnosed by the compiler. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>7/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The actual Element parameter of access subprogram Process of Update{"_"}Element may be constrained even if Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained.<br /></li>
<MarginText>8/4_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<li>The operations Append, Insert, Prepend, and Replace{"_"}Element that have a formal parameter of type Element{"_"}Type perform indefinite insertion (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>).<br /></li>
<MarginText>9/5_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<li>The description of Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>10/5_A.18.12</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with elements is prohibited for Container, and False otherwise. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>10.a/5_A.18.12</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Complete replacement of an element can cause its memory to be deallocated while another operation is holding onto a reference to it. That can't be allowed. However, a simple modification of (part of) an element is not a problem. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>11/5_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited in the postcondition for the operations Reference and Constant{"_"}Reference.<br /></li>
<MarginText>12/5_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<li>The operations Replace{"_"}Element and Swap are omitted from the nested package Stable.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>12.a/2_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>12.b/4_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Defined some routines to &ldquo;perform indefinite insertion&rdquo;. This could mean that some calls to those routines would now raise Program{"_"}Error where they previously worked. However, this is extremely unlikely; see Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.11">A.18.11</a> for details.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>12.c/5_A.18.12</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Defined the Iterator{"_"}View aspect, so that the stable view is used for container element iterators. This leads to a rare situation where Program{"_"}Error will be raised in Ada 2022 for code that would have worked in Ada 2012. See Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.11">A.18.11</a> for details. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.13"></a>

## A.18.13  The Generic Package Containers.Indefinite_Hashed_Maps

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Maps provides a map with the same operations as the package Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">A.18.5</a>), with the difference that the generic formal types Key{"_"}Type and Element{"_"}Type are indefinite. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.13</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0092-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Maps has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The generic formal Key{"_"}Type is indefinite.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<li>The generic formal Element{"_"}Type is indefinite.<br /></li>
<MarginText>5/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<li>The procedure with the profile: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>6/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>is omitted.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.a/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This procedure is omitted because there is no way to create a default-initialized object of an indefinite type. We considered having this routine insert an empty element similar to the empty elements of a vector, but rejected this possibility because the semantics are fairly complex and very different from the existing case. That would make it more error-prone to convert a container from a definite type to an indefinite type; by omitting the routine completely, any problems will be diagnosed by the compiler. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>8/2_A.18.13</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The actual Element parameter of access subprogram Process of Update{"_"}Element may be constrained even if Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained.<br /></li>
<MarginText>9/4_A.18.13</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<li>The operations Include, Insert, Replace, and Replace{"_"}Element that have a formal parameter of type Element{"_"}Type perform indefinite insertion (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>). <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>9.a/4_A.18.13</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Some of the named operations also have a formal of the indefinite formal type Key{"_"}Type and perform indefinite insertion using that value, but it is sufficient to mention the formal of type Element{"_"}Type to cover those. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>10/5_A.18.13</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The description of Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>11/5_A.18.13</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with elements is prohibited for Container, and False otherwise. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>11.a/5_A.18.13</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Complete replacement of an element can cause its memory to be deallocated while another operation is holding onto a reference to it. That can't be allowed. However, a simple modification of (part of) an element is not a problem. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>12/5_A.18.13</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited in the postcondition for the operations Reference and Constant{"_"}Reference.<br /></li>
<MarginText>13/5_A.18.13</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<li>The operations Replace and Replace{"_"}Element are omitted from the nested package Stable.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
The generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Maps is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>13.b/4_A.18.13</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Defined some routines to &ldquo;perform indefinite insertion&rdquo;. This could mean that some calls to those routines would now raise Program{"_"}Error where they previously worked. However, this is extremely unlikely; see Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.11">A.18.11</a> for details.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />

This leads to a rare situation where Program{"_"}Error will be raised in Ada 2022 for code that would have worked in Ada 2012. See Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.11">A.18.11</a> for details. <br />

## A.18.14  The Generic Package Containers.Indefinite_Ordered_Maps

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Ordered{"_"}Maps provides a map with the same operations as the package Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">A.18.6</a>), with the difference that the generic formal types Key{"_"}Type and Element{"_"}Type are indefinite. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.14</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0092-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Ordered{"_"}Maps has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The generic formal Key{"_"}Type is indefinite.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<li>The generic formal Element{"_"}Type is indefinite.<br /></li>
<MarginText>5/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<li>The procedure with the profile: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>6/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Insert (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                  Key       : in     Key{"_"}Type;{"\n"}                  Position  :    out Cursor;{"\n"}                  Inserted  :    out Boolean);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>is omitted.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>7.a/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This procedure is omitted because there is no way to create a default-initialized object of an indefinite type. We considered having this routine insert an empty element similar to the empty elements of a vector, but rejected this possibility because the semantics are fairly complex and very different from the existing case. That would make it more error-prone to convert a container from a definite type to an indefinite type; by omitting the routine completely, any problems will be diagnosed by the compiler. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>8/2_A.18.14</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The actual Element parameter of access subprogram Process of Update{"_"}Element may be constrained even if Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained.<br /></li>
<MarginText>9/4_A.18.14</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<li>The operations Include, Insert, Replace, and Replace{"_"}Element that have a formal parameter of type Element{"_"}Type perform indefinite insertion (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>). <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>9.a/4_A.18.14</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Some of the named operations also have a formal of the indefinite formal type Key{"_"}Type and perform indefinite insertion using that value, but it is sufficient to mention the formal of type Element{"_"}Type to cover those. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>10/5_A.18.14</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The description of Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>11/5_A.18.14</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with elements is prohibited for Container, and False otherwise. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>11.a/5_A.18.14</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Complete replacement of an element can cause its memory to be deallocated while another operation is holding onto a reference to it. That can't be allowed. However, a simple modification of (part of) an element is not a problem. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>12/5_A.18.14</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited in the postcondition for the operations Reference and Constant{"_"}Reference.<br /></li>
<MarginText>13/5_A.18.14</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<li>The operations Replace and Replace{"_"}Element are omitted from the nested package Stable.<br /></li>
</ul>

## A.18.15  The Generic Package Containers.Indefinite_Hashed_Sets

<MarginText>1/2_A.18.15</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Sets provides a set with the same operations as the package Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.8">A.18.8</a>), with the difference that the generic formal type Element{"_"}Type is indefinite. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.15</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03", "AI05-0092-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Sets has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/2_A.18.15</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The generic formal Element{"_"}Type is indefinite.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/2_A.18.15</MarginText>
<li>The actual Element parameter of access subprogram Process of Update{"_"}Element{"_"}Preserving{"_"}Key may be constrained even if Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained.<br /></li>
<MarginText>5/4_A.18.15</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<li>The operations Include, Insert, Replace, Replace{"_"}Element, and To{"_"}Set that have a formal parameter of type Element{"_"}Type perform indefinite insertion (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>). <br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>5.a/4_A.18.15</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>This includes the procedure Replace declared in the nested generic package Generic{"_"}Keys, as well as the routines declared directly in the Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Sets package. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>5.b/5_A.18.15</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>Unlike the other containers, a Hashed{"_"}Set has no operations that tamper with elements without tampering with cursors. Modifying the contents of a element of a set can change its position in the set, so those operations tamper with cursors.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>5.c/5_A.18.15</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Because of this characteristic, this subclause is missing the rules that other indefinite containers have modifying the definition and use of Tampering{"_"}with{"_"}Elements, and the definition of the Stable subpackaage is the same as the definite version. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 95

</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginInfo items={["AI95-00302-03"]} />

</Admonition>

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.17</MarginText>

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>6/3_A.18.17</MarginText>

<MarginText>6.a/3_A.18.17</MarginText>

<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />

<li>Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited is replaced by Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited in the postcondition for the operations Reference and Constant{"_"}Reference.<br /></li>

## A.18.18  The Generic Package Containers.Indefinite_Holders

<MarginText>1/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Holders provides a private type Holder and a set of operations for that type. A holder container holds a single element of an indefinite type.<br /></p>

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>A holder container allows the declaration of an object that can be used like an uninitialized variable or component of an indefinite type.<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>A holder container may be <i>empty</i>. An empty holder does not contain an element. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>4/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>The generic library package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Holders has the following declaration: <br /></p>

<MarginText>5/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0084-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">

   procedure Replace{"_"}Element (Container : in out Holder;{"\n"}                              New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}      with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                    or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}           Post ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (Container);{"\n"}
