<MarginText>26/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>The actual function for the generic formal function "=" on Element{"_"}Type values is expected to define a reflexive and symmetric relationship and return the same result value each time it is called with a particular pair of values. If it behaves in some other manner, the function "=" on holder values returns an unspecified value. The exact arguments and number of calls of this generic formal function by the function "=" on holder values are unspecified.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>26.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>If the actual function for "=" is not symmetric and consistent, the result returned by any of the functions defined to use "=" cannot be predicted. The implementation is not required to protect against "=" raising an exception, or returning random results, or any other "bad" behavior. And it can call "=" in whatever manner makes sense. But note that only the results of the function "=" is unspecified; other subprograms are not allowed to break if "=" is bad. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>27/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>The type Holder is used to represent holder containers. The type Holder needs finalization (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-7/AA-7.6">7.6</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>28/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>Empty{"_"}Holder represents an empty holder object. If an object of type Holder is not otherwise initialized, it is initialized to the same value as Empty{"_"}Holder.<br /></p>

<MarginText>29/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p>[Some operations check for &ldquo;tampering with the element&rdquo; of a container because they depend on the element of the container not being replaced.] When tampering with the element is <i>prohibited</i> for a particular holder object <i>H</i>, Program{"_"}Error is propagated by the finalization of <i>H</i>[, as well as by a call that passes <i>H</i> to certain of the operations of this package, as indicated by the precondition of such an operation].<br /></p>

<p><i>Paragraphs 30 through 35 are removed as preconditions now describe these rules.</i> <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>34.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Complete replacement of an element can cause its memory to be deallocated while another operation is holding onto a reference to it. That can't be allowed. However, a simple modification of (part of) an element is not a problem, so Update{"_"}Element does not cause a problem. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>36/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function "=" (Left, Right : Holder) return Boolean;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>37/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Left and Right denote the same holder object, then the function returns True. Otherwise, it compares the element contained in Left to the element contained in Right using the generic formal equality operator, returning the result of that operation. Any exception raised during the evaluation of element equality is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>37.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>This wording describes the canonical semantics. However, the order and number of calls on the formal equality <b>function</b> is unspecified, so an implementation need not call the equality function if the correct answer can be determined without doing so. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>37.1/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited{"\n"}  (Container : Holder) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>37.2/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if tampering with the element is currently prohibited for Container, and returns False otherwise.<br /></p>

<MarginText>38/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function To{"_"}Holder (New{"_"}Item : Element{"_"}Type) return Holder{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (To{"_"}Holder'Result);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>39/4_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI12-0035-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a nonempty holder containing an element initialized to New{"_"}Item. To{"_"}Holder performs indefinite insertion (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>40/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Is{"_"}Empty (Container : Holder) return Boolean{"\n"}   with Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>41/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns True if Container is empty, and False if it contains an element.<br /></p>

<MarginText>42/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Clear (Container : in out Holder){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                 or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is{"_"}Empty (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>43/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Removes the element from Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>44/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Element (Container : Holder) return Element{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} Element{"_"}Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>45/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns the element stored in Container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>46/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Replace{"_"}Element (Container : in out Holder;{"\n"}                           New{"_"}Item  : in     Element{"_"}Type){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Container){"\n"}                 or else raise Program{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (Container);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>47/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI12-0035-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Replace{"_"}Element assigns the value New{"_"}Item into Container, replacing any preexisting content of Container; Replace{"_"}Element performs indefinite insertion (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18">A.18</a>).<br /></p>

<MarginText>48/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Query{"_"}Element{"\n"}  (Container : in Holder;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Element : in Element{"_"}Type)){"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>49/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Query{"_"}Element calls Process.<b>all</b> with the contained element as the argument. Tampering with the element of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>49.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The &ldquo;tamper with the element&rdquo; check is intended to prevent the Element parameter of Process from being replaced or deleted outside of Process. The check prevents data loss (if Element{"_"}Type is passed by copy) or erroneous execution (if Element{"_"}Type is an unconstrained type). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>50/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Update{"_"}Element{"\n"}  (Container : in out Holder;{"\n"}   Process   : not null access procedure (Element : in out Element{"_"}Type)){"\n"}   with Pre ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>51/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Update{"_"}Element calls Process.<b>all</b> with the contained element as the argument. Tampering with the element of Container is prohibited during the execution of the call on Process.<b>all</b>. Any exception raised by Process.<b>all</b> is propagated.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>51.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The Element parameter of Process.<b>all</b> may be constrained even if Element{"_"}Type is unconstrained. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>52/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
type Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}      (Element : not null access constant Element{"_"}Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit{"_"}Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} (raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}
<MarginText>53/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
type Reference{"_"}Type (Element : not null access Element{"_"}Type) is private{"\n"}   with Implicit{"_"}Dereference ={">"} Element,{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} in out synchronized,{"\n"}        Default{"_"}Initial{"_"}Condition ={">"} (raise Program{"_"}Error);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>54/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">The types Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type and Reference{"_"}Type need finalization.<br /></p>

<MarginText>55/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4"><i>This paragraph was deleted.</i><br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>55.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>It is expected that Reference{"_"}Type (and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type) will be a controlled type, for which finalization will have some action to terminate the tampering check for the associated container. If the object is created by default, however, there is no associated container. Since this is useless, and supporting this case would take extra work, we define it to raise an exception. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>56/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Constant{"_"}Reference (Container : aliased in Holder){"\n"}   return Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>57/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspect) provides a convenient way to gain read access to the contained element of a holder container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>58/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Constant{"_"}Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the contained element. Tampering with the element of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Constant{"_"}Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>59/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Reference (Container : aliased in out Holder){"\n"}   return Reference{"_"}Type{"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} not Is{"_"}Empty (Container) or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error,{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Container),{"\n"}        Nonblocking, Global ={">"} null, Use{"_"}Formal ={">"} null;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>60/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This function (combined with the Implicit{"_"}Dereference aspects) provides a convenient way to gain read and write access to the contained element of a holder container.<br /></p>

<MarginText>61/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0262-1", "AI05-0265-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Reference returns an object whose discriminant is an access value that designates the contained element. Tampering with the element of Container is prohibited while the object returned by Reference exists and has not been finalized.<br /></p>

<MarginText>62/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Assign (Target : in out Holder; Source : in Holder){"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (Is{"_"}Empty (Source) = Is{"_"}Empty (Target));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>63/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, the operation has no effect. If Source is empty, Clear (Target) is called. Otherwise, Replace{"_"}Element (Target, Element (Source)) is called. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>63.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0005-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="discussion">
<b></b>This routine exists for compatibility with the other containers. For a holder, Assign(A, B) and A := B behave effectively the same. (Assign Clears the Target, while := finalizes the Target, but these should have similar effects.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>64/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
function Copy (Source : Holder) return Holder{"\n"}   with Post ={">"} (Is{"_"}Empty (Source) = Is{"_"}Empty (Copy'Result));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>65/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Source is empty, returns an empty holder container; otherwise, returns To{"_"}Holder (Element (Source)).<br /></p>

<MarginText>66/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Move (Target : in out Holder; Source : in out Holder){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Source){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} (if not Target'Has{"_"}Same{"_"}Storage (Source) then{"\n"}                   Is{"_"}Empty (Source) and then (not Is{"_"}Empty (Target)));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>67/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Target denotes the same object as Source, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, the element contained by Source (if any) is removed from Source and inserted into Target, replacing any preexisting content.<br /></p>

<MarginText>67.1/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
procedure Swap (Left, Right : in out Holder){"\n"}   with Pre  ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Left){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}                (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}The{"_"}Element{"_"}Prohibited (Right){"\n"}                   or else raise Program{"_"}Error),{"\n"}        Post ={">"} Is{"_"}Empty (Left) = Is{"_"}Empty (Right)'Old and then{"\n"}                Is{"_"}Empty (Right) = Is{"_"}Empty (Left)'Old;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>67.2/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0350-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">If Left denotes the same object as Right, then the operation has no effect. Otherwise, operation exchanges the elements (if any) contained by Left and Right.<br /></p>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>68/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0022-1", "AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0248-1", "AI05-0262-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error for the actual function associated with a generic formal subprogram, when called as part of an operation of this package, to tamper with the element of any Holder parameter of the operation. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised, or the operation works as defined on the value of the Holder either prior to, or subsequent to, some or all of the modifications to the Holder.<br /></p>

<MarginText>69/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0027-1", "AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to call any subprogram declared in the visible part of Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Holders when the associated container has been finalized. If the operation takes Container as an <b>in out</b> parameter, then it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. Otherwise, the operation either proceeds as it would for an empty container, or it raises Constraint{"_"}Error or Program{"_"}Error. <br /></p>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>70/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>Execution is erroneous if the holder container associated with the result of a call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized before the result object returned by the call to Reference or Constant{"_"}Reference is finalized.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>70.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>Each object of Reference{"_"}Type and Constant{"_"}Reference{"_"}Type probably contains some reference to the originating container. If that container is prematurely finalized (which is only possible via Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation, as accessibility checks prevent passing a container to Reference that will not live as long as the result), the finalization of the object of Reference{"_"}Type will try to access a nonexistent object. This is a normal case of a dangling pointer created by Unchecked{"_"}Deallocation; we have to explicitly mention it here as the pointer in question is not visible in the specification of the type. (This is the same reason we have to say this for invalid cursors.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>71/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1"]} />
<p>No storage associated with a holder object shall be lost upon assignment or scope exit.<br /></p>

<MarginText>72/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>The execution of an <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-5/AA-5.2#S0173">assignment_statement</a></code> for a holder container shall have the effect of copying the element (if any) from the source holder object to the target holder object.<br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>72.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0298-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>An assignment of a holder container is a &ldquo;deep&rdquo; copy; that is the element is copied as well as any data structures. We say &ldquo;effect of&rdquo; in order to allow the implementation to avoid copying the element immediately if it wishes. For instance, an implementation that avoided copying until one of the containers is modified would be allowed. (Note that this implementation would require care, see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more.) <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>73/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0269-1", "AI12-0350-1"]} />
<p>Move and Swap should not copy any elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>73.a.1/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Move and Swap in Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Holders should not copy any elements, and should minimize copying of internal data structures.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>73.a/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0350-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>Usually that can be accomplished simply by moving the pointer(s) to the internal data structures appropriately. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>74/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>If an exception is propagated from a holder operation, no storage should be lost, nor should the element be removed from a holder container unless specified by the operation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>74.a.1/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>If an exception is propagated from a holder operation, no storage should be lost, nor should the element be removed from a holder container unless specified by the operation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>74.a/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is important so that programs can recover from errors. But we don't want to require heroic efforts, so we just require documentation of cases where this can't be accomplished. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>74.b/3_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0069-1", "AI05-0084-1", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
 The generic package Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Holders is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>74.c/4_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0035-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Defined some routines to &ldquo;perform indefinite insertion&rdquo;. This could mean that some calls to those routines would now raise Program{"_"}Error where they previously worked. However, this is extremely unlikely; see Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.11">A.18.11</a> for details. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>74.d/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1", "AI12-0112-1", "AI12-0350-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
A number of new subprograms and types were added to Containers.Indefinite{"_"}Holders to better support contracts and provide additional functionality. Therefore, a use clause conflict is possible; see the introduction of <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/">Annex A</a> for more on this topic. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Wording Changes from Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>74.e/4_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0110-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
<b>Corrigendum:</b> Clarified that tampering checks precede all other checks made by a subprogram (but come after those associated with the call).<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>74.f/5_A.18.18</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
Added contracts to this container. This includes describing some of the semantics with pre- and postconditions, rather than English text. Note that the preconditions can be Suppressed (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-11/AA-11.5">11.5</a>). <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.19"></a>

## A.18.19  The Generic Package Containers.Bounded_Vectors

<MarginText>1/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Vectors provides a private type Vector and a set of operations. It provides the same operations as the package Containers.Vectors (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a>), with the difference that the maximum storage is bounded. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Vectors has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Vectors except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The aspect Preelaborate is replaced with aspect Pure. Aspect Global is deleted.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The Global aspect for a Pure package is <b>null</b> (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-6/AA-6.1#Subclause_6.1.2">6.1.2</a>), so we don't need to give it explicitly. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>4/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The type Vector is declared with a discriminant that specifies the capacity: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  type Vector (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type) is tagged private...{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>5.1/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-13/AA-13.1#S0348">aspect_definition</a></code> for Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization for type Vector is changed to: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5.2/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization ={">"}{"\n"}     Element{"_"}Type'Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>6/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The type Vector needs finalization if and only if type Element{"_"}Type needs finalization.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>6.a/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The type Vector cannot depend on package Ada.Finalization unless the element type depends on that package. The objects returned from the Iterator and Reference functions probably do depend on package Ada.Finalization. Restricted environments may need to avoid use of those functions and their associated types. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>6.1/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>Capacity is omitted from the Stable{"_"}Properties of type Vector.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>6.b/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>The capacity is a discriminant here, so it can't be changed by most routines; thus including it in the stable properties adds no information. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>6.2/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In function Empty, the postcondition is altered to:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>6.3/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   Post ={">"}{"\n"}      Empty'Result.Capacity = Capacity and then{"\n"}      not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}      not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}      Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In function Copy, the postcondition is altered to: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>7.1/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   Post ={">"} Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}           (if Capacity {">"} Length (Source) then{"\n"}              Copy'Result.Capacity = Capacity{"\n"}            else Copy'Result.Capacity {">"}= Length (Source));{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>8/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The description of Reserve{"_"}Capacity is replaced with:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>8.1/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   procedure Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Container : in out Vector;{"\n"}                               Capacity  : in     Count{"_"}Type){"\n"}      with Pre ={">"} Capacity {"<"}= Container.Capacity {"\n"}                      or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>9/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This operation has no effect, [other than checking the precondition]. <br /></p>

<MarginText>9.1/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The portion of the postcondition checking the capacity is omitted from subprograms Set{"_"}Length, Assign, Insert, Insert{"_"}Space, Prepend, Append, and Delete.<br /></li>
<MarginText>9.2/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<li>For procedures Insert, Insert{"_"}Space, Prepend, and Append, the part of the precondition reading:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>9.3/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Maximum{"_"}Length - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>9.4/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>9.5/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Maximum{"_"}Length - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Container.Capacity - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>

#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>10/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to assign from a bounded vector object while tampering with elements [or cursors] of that object is prohibited. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised by the assignment, execution proceeds with the target object prohibiting tampering with elements [or cursors], or execution proceeds normally. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>10.a/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Tampering with elements includes tampering with cursors, so we only really need to talk about tampering with elements here; we mention cursors for clarity. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>11/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>When a bounded vector object <i>V</i> is finalized, if tampering with cursors is prohibited for <i>V</i> other than due to an assignment from another vector, then execution is erroneous. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>11.a/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is a tampering event, but since the implementation is not allowed to use Ada.Finalization, it is not possible in a pure Ada implementation to detect this error. (There is no Finalize routine that will be called that could make the check.) Since the check probably cannot be made, the bad effects that could occur (such as an iterator going into an infinite loop or accessing a nonexistent element) cannot be prevented and we have to allow anything. We do allow re-assigning an object that only prohibits tampering because it was copied from another object as that cannot cause any negative effects. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>12/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>For each instance of Containers.Vectors and each instance of Containers.Bounded{"_"}Vectors, if the two instances meet the following conditions, then the output generated by the Vector'Output or Vector'Write subprograms of either instance shall be readable by the Vector'Input or Vector'Read of the other instance, respectively:<br /></p>

<MarginText>13/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>the Element{"_"}Type parameters of the two instances are statically matching subtypes of the same type; and<br /></li>
<MarginText>14/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the output generated by Element{"_"}Type'Output or Element{"_"}Type'Write is readable by Element{"_"}Type'Input or Element{"_"}Type'Read, respectively (where Element{"_"}Type denotes the type of the two actual Element{"_"}Type parameters); and<br /></li>
<MarginText>15/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the preceding two conditions also hold for the Index{"_"}Type parameters of the instances. <br /></li>
</ul>

#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>16/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>Bounded vector objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>16.a.1/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Bounded vector objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>17/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The implementation advice for procedure Move to minimize copying does not apply. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>17.a.1/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The implementation advice for procedure Move to minimize copying does not apply to bounded vectors.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>17.a/3_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0184-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
 The generic package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Vectors is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>17.b/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Tampering with elements is now defined to be equivalent to tampering with cursors for bounded containers. If a program requires tampering detection to work, it might fail in Ada 2022. Needless to say, this shouldn't happen outside of test programs. See Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more details. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>17.c/5_A.18.19</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b>A bounded vector now only has Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization (abbreviated PI in this note) when the actual for the Element{"_"}Type has PI. If an program used a vector whose actual Element{"_"}Type does not have PI in a context when PI is required (such as a library-level object in a preelaborated unit or as a component of a type with PI), the program would be illegal in Ada 2022 but legal in original Ada 2012. This situation is unlikely, especially as some existing Ada 2012 implementations reject the instance in this case. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.20"></a>

## A.18.20  The Generic Package Containers.Bounded_Doubly_Linked_Lists

<MarginText>1/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists provides a private type List and a set of operations. It provides the same operations as the package Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.3">A.18.3</a>), with the difference that the maximum storage is bounded. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The aspect Preelaborate is replaced with aspect Pure. Aspect Global is deleted.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>3.a/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="ramification">
<b></b>The Global aspect for a Pure package is <b>null</b> (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-6/AA-6.1#Subclause_6.1.2">6.1.2</a>), so we don't need to give it explicitly. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>4/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The type List is declared with a discriminant that specifies the capacity (maximum number of elements) as follows: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  type List (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type) is tagged private...{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>5.1/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-13/AA-13.1#S0348">aspect_definition</a></code> for Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization for type List is changed to: <br /></li>

  Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization ={">"}{"\n"}     Element{"_"}Type'Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>6/3_A.18.20</MarginText>

</ul>

<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />

The objects returned from the Iterator and Reference functions probably do depend on package Ada.Finalization. Restricted environments may need to avoid use of those functions and their associated types. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>6.1/5_A.18.20</MarginText>

   function Empty (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := implementation-defined){"\n"}      return List{"\n"}      with Post ={">"}{"\n"}            Empty'Result.Capacity = Capacity and then{"\n"}            not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}            not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}            Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>For procedures Insert, Prepend, Append, Merge, and the three-parameter Splice whose parameter Source has type List, the part of the precondition reading:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>7.1/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>

<ul>
<li>is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>7.3/5_A.18.20</MarginText>

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>8/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In procedure Assign, the precondition is altered to: <br /></li>

   Pre ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}             or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}          (Length (Source) {"<"}= Target.Capacity{"\n"}             or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error),{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>

  function Copy (Source : List; Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := 0){"\n"}     return List{"\n"}     with Pre  ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                     or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error,{"\n"}          Post ={">"} {"\n"}             Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}             not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}             not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}             Copy'Result.Capacity = (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}                Length (Source) else Capacity);{"\n"}

#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>14/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to assign from a bounded list object while tampering with elements [or cursors] of that object is prohibited. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised by the assignment, execution proceeds with the target object prohibiting tampering with elements [or cursors], or execution proceeds normally. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>14.a/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Tampering with elements includes tampering with cursors, so we only really need to talk about tampering with elements here; we mention cursors for clarity. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>15/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>When a bounded list object <i>L</i> is finalized, if tampering with cursors is prohibited for <i>L</i> other than due to an assignment from another list, then execution is erroneous. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>15.a/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is a tampering event, but since the implementation is not allowed to use Ada.Finalization, it is not possible in a pure Ada implementation to detect this error. (There is no Finalize routine that will be called that could make the check.) Since the check probably cannot be made, the bad effects that could occur (such as an iterator going into an infinite loop or accessing a nonexistent element) cannot be prevented and we have to allow anything. We do allow re-assigning an object that only prohibits tampering because it was copied from another object as that cannot cause any negative effects. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>16/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>For each instance of Containers.Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists and each instance of Containers.Bounded{"_"}Doubly{"_"}Linked{"_"}Lists, if the two instances meet the following conditions, then the output generated by the List'Output or List'Write subprograms of either instance shall be readable by the List'Input or List'Read of the other instance, respectively:<br /></p>

<MarginText>17/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>the Element{"_"}Type parameters of the two instances are statically matching subtypes of the same type; and<br /></li>
<MarginText>18/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the output generated by Element{"_"}Type'Output or Element{"_"}Type'Write is readable by Element{"_"}Type'Input or Element{"_"}Type'Read, respectively (where Element{"_"}Type denotes the type of the two actual Element{"_"}Type parameters). <br /></li>
</ul>

#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>19/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>Bounded list objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.a.1/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Bounded list objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>20/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The implementation advice for procedure Move to minimize copying does not apply. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>20.a.1/3_A.18.20</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The implementation advice for procedure Move to minimize copying does not apply to bounded lists.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>20.b/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Tampering with elements is now defined to be equivalent to tampering with cursors for bounded containers. If a program requires tampering detection to work, it might fail in Ada 2022. Needless to say, this shouldn't happen outside of test programs. See Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more details. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>20.c/5_A.18.20</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b>A bounded list now only has Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization (abbreviated PI in this note) when the actual for the Element{"_"}Type has PI. If an program used a list whose actual Element{"_"}Type does not have PI in a context when PI is required (such as a library-level object in a preelaborated unit or as a component of a type with PI), the program would be illegal in Ada 2022 but legal in original Ada 2012. This situation is unlikely, especially as some existing Ada 2012 implementations reject the instance in this case. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.21"></a>

## A.18.21  The Generic Package Containers.Bounded_Hashed_Maps

<MarginText>1/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Maps provides a private type Map and a set of operations. It provides the same operations as the package Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.5">A.18.5</a>), with the difference that the maximum storage is bounded. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Maps has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The aspect Preelaborate is replaced with aspect Pure. Aspect Global is deleted.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<li>The type Map is declared with discriminants that specify both the capacity (number of elements) and modulus (number of distinct hash values) of the hash table as follows: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  type Map (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type;{"\n"}            Modulus  : Hash{"_"}Type) is tagged private...{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>5.1/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-13/AA-13.1#S0348">aspect_definition</a></code> for Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization for type Map is changed to: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5.2/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization ={">"}{"\n"}     Element{"_"}Type'Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization{"\n"}        and{"\n"}     Key{"_"}Type'Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>6/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The type Map needs finalization if and only if type Key{"_"}Type or type Element{"_"}Type needs finalization.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>6.a/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The type Map cannot depend on package Ada.Finalization unless the element or key type depends on that package. The objects returned from the Iterator and Reference functions probably do depend on package Ada.Finalization. Restricted environments may need to avoid use of those functions and their associated types. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>6.1/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In function Empty, the postcondition is altered to:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>6.2/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   Post ={">"}{"\n"}      Empty'Result.Capacity = Capacity and then{"\n"}      Empty'Result.Modulus = Default{"_"}Modulus (Capacity) and then{"\n"}      not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}      not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}      Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The description of Reserve{"_"}Capacity is replaced with:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>7.1/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   procedure Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Container : in out Map;{"\n"}                               Capacity  : in     Count{"_"}Type){"\n"}      with Pre ={">"} Capacity {"<"}= Container.Capacity {"\n"}                      or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>8/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This operation has no effect, [other than checking the precondition]. <br /></p>

<MarginText>9/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>An additional operation is added immediately following Reserve{"_"}Capacity: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>10/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  function Default{"_"}Modulus (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type) return Hash{"_"}Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>11/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Default{"_"}Modulus returns an implementation-defined value for the number of distinct hash values to be used for the given capacity (maximum number of elements). <br /></p>

<MarginText>11.1/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>For procedures Insert and Include, the part of the precondition reading:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>11.2/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>11.3/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>11.4/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}     ({"<"}some length{">"} {">"} Container.Capacity - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>11.5/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In procedure Assign, the precondition is altered to: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>11.6/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   Pre ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}             or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}          (Length (Source) {"<"}= Target.Capacity{"\n"}             or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error),{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>12/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The function Copy is replaced with: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>13/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  function Copy (Source   : Map;{"\n"}                 Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := 0;{"\n"}                 Modulus  : Hash{"_"}Type := 0) return Map{"\n"}     with Pre  ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                     or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error,{"\n"}          Post ={">"} {"\n"}             Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}             not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}             not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}             Copy'Result.Capacity = (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}                Length (Source) else Capacity) and then{"\n"}             Copy'Result.Modulus = (if Modulus = 0 then{"\n"}                Default{"_"}Modulus (Capacity) else Modulus);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>14/5_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a map with key/element pairs initialized from the values in Source. <br /></p>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>15/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to assign from a bounded map object while tampering with elements [or cursors] of that object is prohibited. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised by the assignment, execution proceeds with the target object prohibiting tampering with elements [or cursors], or execution proceeds normally. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>15.a/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Tampering with elements includes tampering with cursors, so we only really need to talk about tampering with elements here; we mention cursors for clarity. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>16/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>When a bounded map object <i>M</i> is finalized, if tampering with cursors is prohibited for <i>M</i> other than due to an assignment from another map, then execution is erroneous. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>16.a/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is a tampering event, but since the implementation is not allowed to use Ada.Finalization, it is not possible in a pure Ada implementation to detect this error. (There is no Finalize routine that will be called that could make the check.) Since the check probably cannot be made, the bad effects that could occur (such as an iterator going into an infinite loop or accessing a nonexistent element) cannot be prevented and we have to allow anything. We do allow re-assigning an object that only prohibits tampering because it was copied from another object as that cannot cause any negative effects. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>17/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>For each instance of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Maps and each instance of Containers.Bounded{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Maps, if the two instances meet the following conditions, then the output generated by the Map'Output or Map'Write subprograms of either instance shall be readable by the Map'Input or Map'Read of the other instance, respectively:<br /></p>

<MarginText>18/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>the Element{"_"}Type parameters of the two instances are statically matching subtypes of the same type; and<br /></li>
<MarginText>19/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the output generated by Element{"_"}Type'Output or Element{"_"}Type'Write is readable by Element{"_"}Type'Input or Element{"_"}Type'Read, respectively (where Element{"_"}Type denotes the type of the two actual Element{"_"}Type parameters); and<br /></li>
<MarginText>20/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the preceding two conditions also hold for the Key{"_"}Type parameters of the instances. <br /></li>
</ul>

#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>21/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>Bounded hashed map objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>21.a.1/3_A.18.21</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Bounded hashed map objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation.<br />

<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b>A bounded map now only has Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization (abbreviated PI in this note) when the actuals for the Element{"_"}Type and the Key{"_"}Type have PI. If an program used a map whose actual Element{"_"}Type or Key{"_"}Type does not have PI in a context when PI is required (such as a library-level object in a preelaborated unit or as a component of a type with PI), the program would be illegal in Ada 2022 but legal in original Ada 2012. This situation is unlikely, especially as some existing Ada 2012 implementations reject the instance in this case. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<a id="Subclause_A.18.22"></a>

## A.18.22  The Generic Package Containers.Bounded_Ordered_Maps

<MarginText>1/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Ordered{"_"}Maps provides a private type Map and a set of operations. It provides the same operations as the package Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.6">A.18.6</a>), with the difference that the maximum storage is bounded. <br /></p>


#### Static Semantics

<MarginText>2/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The declaration of the generic library package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Ordered{"_"}Maps has the same contents and semantics as Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps except:<br /></p>

<MarginText>3/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The aspect Preelaborate is replaced with aspect Pure. Aspect Global is deleted.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<li>The type Map is declared with a discriminant that specifies the capacity (maximum number of elements) as follows: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  type Map (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type) is tagged private...{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>5.1/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-13/AA-13.1#S0348">aspect_definition</a></code> for Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization for type Map is changed to: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5.2/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization ={">"}{"\n"}     Element{"_"}Type'Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization{"\n"}        and{"\n"}     Key{"_"}Type'Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>6/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The type Map needs finalization if and only if type Key{"_"}Type or type Element{"_"}Type needs finalization.<br /></li>
</ul>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>6.a/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0212-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-note">
<b></b>The type Map cannot depend on package Ada.Finalization unless the element type depends on that package. The objects returned from the Iterator and Reference functions probably do depend on package Ada.Finalization. Restricted environments may need to avoid use of those functions and their associated types. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>6.1/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The function Empty is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>6.2/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   function Empty (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := implementation-defined){"\n"}      return Map{"\n"}      with Post ={">"}{"\n"}            Empty'Result.Capacity = Capacity and then{"\n"}            not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}            not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}            Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>For procedures Insert and Include, the part of the precondition reading:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>7.1/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7.2/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>7.3/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}         or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}      ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Container.Capacity - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}         or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>8/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In procedure Assign, the precondition is altered to:<br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>8.1/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   Pre ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}             or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}          (Length (Source) {"<"}= Target.Capacity{"\n"}             or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error),{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>9/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The function Copy is replaced with: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>10/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  function Copy (Source   : Map;{"\n"}                 Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := 0) return Map{"\n"}     with Pre  ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                     or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error,{"\n"}          Post ={">"} {"\n"}             Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}             not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Elements{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}             not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}             Copy'Result.Capacity = (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}                Length (Source) else Capacity);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>11/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a map with key/element pairs initialized from the values in Source. <br /></p>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>12/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to assign from a bounded map object while tampering with elements [or cursors] of that object is prohibited. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised by the assignment, execution proceeds with the target object prohibiting tampering with elements [or cursors], or execution proceeds normally. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>12.a/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">
<b></b>Tampering with elements includes tampering with cursors, so we only really need to talk about tampering with elements here; we mention cursors for clarity. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>13/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>When a bounded map object <i>M</i> is finalized, if tampering with cursors is prohibited for <i>M</i> other than due to an assignment from another map, then execution is erroneous. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>13.a/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is a tampering event, but since the implementation is not allowed to use Ada.Finalization, it is not possible in a pure Ada implementation to detect this error. (There is no Finalize routine that will be called that could make the check.) Since the check probably cannot be made, the bad effects that could occur (such as an iterator going into an infinite loop or accessing a nonexistent element) cannot be prevented and we have to allow anything. We do allow re-assigning an object that only prohibits tampering because it was copied from another object as that cannot cause any negative effects. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginText>14/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>For each instance of Containers.Ordered{"_"}Maps and each instance of Containers.Bounded{"_"}Ordered{"_"}Maps, if the two instances meet the following conditions, then the output generated by the Map'Output or Map'Write subprograms of either instance shall be readable by the Map'Input or Map'Read of the other instance, respectively:<br /></p>

<MarginText>15/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>the Element{"_"}Type parameters of the two instances are statically matching subtypes of the same type; and<br /></li>
<MarginText>16/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the output generated by Element{"_"}Type'Output or Element{"_"}Type'Write is readable by Element{"_"}Type'Input or Element{"_"}Type'Read, respectively (where Element{"_"}Type denotes the type of the two actual Element{"_"}Type parameters); and<br /></li>
<MarginText>17/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the preceding two conditions also hold for the Key{"_"}Type parameters of the instances. <br /></li>
</ul>

#### Implementation Advice

<MarginText>18/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />
<p>Bounded ordered map objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>18.a.1/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>Bounded ordered map objects should be implemented without implicit pointers or dynamic allocation.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>19/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The implementation advice for procedure Move to minimize copying does not apply. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.a.1/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="implementation-advice">
<b></b>The implementation advice for procedure Move to minimize copying does not apply to bounded ordered maps.<br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Extensions to Ada 2005

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.a/3_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0184-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="note">
 The generic package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Ordered{"_"}Maps is new. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Inconsistencies With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.b/5_A.18.22</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0111-1"]} />
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b> Tampering with elements is now defined to be equivalent to tampering with cursors for bounded containers. If a program requires tampering detection to work, it might fail in Ada 2022. Needless to say, this shouldn't happen outside of test programs. See Inconsistencies With Ada 2012 in <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.2">A.18.2</a> for more details. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<AnnotatedOnly>

#### Incompatibilities With Ada 2012

</AnnotatedOnly>
<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>19.c/5_A.18.22</MarginText>

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="correction">
<b></b>A bounded map now only has Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization (abbreviated PI in this note) when the actuals for the Element{"_"}Type and the Key{"_"}Type have PI. If an program used a map whose actual Element{"_"}Type or Key{"_"}Type does not have PI in a context when PI is required (such as a library-level object in a preelaborated unit or as a component of a type with PI), the program would be illegal in Ada 2022 but legal in original Ada 2012. This situation is unlikely, especially as some existing Ada 2012 implementations reject the instance in this case. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

## A.18.23  The Generic Package Containers.Bounded_Hashed_Sets

<MarginText>1/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1"]} />
<p>The language-defined generic package Containers.Bounded{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Sets provides a private type Set and a set of operations. It provides the same operations as the package Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets (see <a href="/docs/arm/AA-A/AA-A.18#Subclause_A.18.8">A.18.8</a>), with the difference that the maximum storage is bounded. <br /></p>

<li>The aspect Preelaborate is replaced with aspect Pure. Aspect Global is deleted.<br /></li>
<MarginText>4/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<li>The type Set is declared with discriminants that specify both the capacity (number of elements) and modulus (number of distinct hash values) of the hash table as follows: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  type Set (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type;{"\n"}            Modulus  : Hash{"_"}Type) is tagged private...{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>5.1/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0409-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>The <code><a href="/docs/arm/AA-13/AA-13.1#S0348">aspect_definition</a></code> for Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization for type Set is changed to: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>5.2/5_A.18.23</MarginText>

  Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization ={">"}{"\n"}     Element{"_"}Type'Preelaborable{"_"}Initialization{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>

<b></b>The type Set cannot depend on package Ada.Finalization unless the element or key type depends on that package. The objects returned from the Iterator and Reference functions probably do depend on package Ada.Finalization. Restricted environments may need to avoid use of those functions and their associated types. <br />
</Admonition>
</AnnotatedOnly>

<MarginText>6.1/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0339-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In function Empty, the postcondition is altered to:<br /></li>
</ul>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
   Post ={">"}{"\n"}      Empty'Result.Capacity = Capacity and then{"\n"}      Empty'Result.Modulus = Default{"_"}Modulus (Capacity) and then{"\n"}      not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Empty'Result) and then{"\n"}      Length (Empty'Result) = 0;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>7/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>The description of Reserve{"_"}Capacity is replaced with: <br /></li>
</ul>
<MarginText>7.1/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
   procedure Reserve{"_"}Capacity (Container : in out Set;{"\n"}                               Capacity  : in     Count{"_"}Type){"\n"}      with Pre ={">"} Capacity {"<"}= Container.Capacity {"\n"}         or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>8/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">This operation has no effect, [other than checking the precondition]. <br /></p>

<MarginText>9/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>An additional operation is added immediately following Reserve{"_"}Capacity: <br /></li>
</ul>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
  function Default{"_"}Modulus (Capacity : Count{"_"}Type) return Hash{"_"}Type;{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>11/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<p class="Indented4">Default{"_"}Modulus returns an implementation-defined value for the number of distinct hash values to be used for the given capacity (maximum number of elements). <br /></p>

<MarginText>11.1/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>For procedures Insert and Include, the part of the precondition reading:<br /></li>
</ul>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>11.3/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<ul>
<li>is replaced by:<br /></li>
</ul>

     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Count{"_"}Type'Last - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Constraint{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}     ({"<"}some length{">"} {"<"}= Container.Capacity - {"<"}some other length{">"}{"\n"}        or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error){"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>11.5/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<ul>
<li>In procedure Assign, the precondition is altered to: <br /></li>
</ul>

<CodeBlock language="ada">
   Pre ={">"} (not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Target){"\n"}             or else raise Program{"_"}Error) and then{"\n"}          (Length (Source) {"<"}= Target.Capacity{"\n"}             or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error),{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>12/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<ul>

<MarginInfo items={["AI12-0112-1"]} />
<CodeBlock language="ada">
  function Copy (Source   : Set;{"\n"}                 Capacity : Count{"_"}Type := 0;{"\n"}                 Modulus  : Hash{"_"}Type := 0) return Map{"\n"}     with Pre  ={">"} Capacity = 0 or else Capacity {">"}= Length (Source){"\n"}                     or else raise Capacity{"_"}Error,{"\n"}          Post ={">"} {"\n"}             Length (Copy'Result) = Length (Source) and then{"\n"}             not Tampering{"_"}With{"_"}Cursors{"_"}Prohibited (Copy'Result) and then{"\n"}             Copy'Result.Capacity = (if Capacity = 0 then{"\n"}                Length (Source) else Capacity) and then{"\n"}             Copy'Result.Modulus = (if Modulus = 0 then{"\n"}                Default{"_"}Modulus (Capacity) else Modulus);{"\n"}

</CodeBlock>
<MarginText>14/5_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p class="Indented4">Returns a set with key/element pairs initialized from the values in Source. <br /></p>


#### Bounded (Run-Time) Errors

<MarginText>15/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0160-1", "AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>It is a bounded error to assign from a bounded set object while tampering with elements [or cursors] of that object is prohibited. Either Program{"_"}Error is raised by the assignment, execution proceeds with the target object prohibiting tampering with elements [or cursors], or execution proceeds normally. <br /></p>

<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="proof">

</AnnotatedOnly>


#### Erroneous Execution

<MarginText>16/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0265-1"]} />
<p>When a bounded set object <i>S</i> is finalized, if tampering with cursors is prohibited for <i>S</i> other than due to an assignment from another set, then execution is erroneous. <br /></p>

<AnnotatedOnly>
<MarginText>16.a/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<Admonition type="aarm" aarm="reason">
<b></b>This is a tampering event, but since the implementation is not allowed to use Ada.Finalization, it is not possible in a pure Ada implementation to detect this error. We do allow re-assigning an object that only prohibits tampering because it was copied from another object as that cannot cause any negative effects. <br />
</Admonition>

#### Implementation Requirements

<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0264-1"]} />
<p>For each instance of Containers.Hashed{"_"}Sets and each instance of Containers.Bounded{"_"}Hashed{"_"}Sets, if the two instances meet the following conditions, then the output generated by the Set'Output or Set'Write subprograms of either instance shall be readable by the Set'Input or Set'Read of the other instance, respectively:<br /></p>

<MarginText>18/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1", "AI05-0248-1"]} />
<ul>

<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0184-1"]} />
<li>the output generated by Element{"_"}Type'Output or Element{"_"}Type'Write is readable by Element{"_"}Type'Input or Element{"_"}Type'Read, respectively (where Element{"_"}Type denotes the type of the two actual Element{"_"}Type parameters). <br /></li>

<MarginText>20/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
<MarginInfo items={["AI05-0001-1", "AI05-0269-1"]} />

<MarginText>20.a.1/3_A.18.23</MarginText>
